commit_message:
Expose neutron api application as a wsgi script

This can then be loaded into a wsgi compatible web server like
apache2/httpd or nginx.

DocImpact A new neutron-api script is installed, and can be used to
start either a standalone wsgi server (calling the script directly),
or as a wsgi script loaded by a web server (e.g. by httpd/mod_wsgi).

Change-Id: Ie9bb8b33f6e1335219e574d832ac264b043d90e6
Partial-Bug: #1666779
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow glance to use file method

Allow glance to use the "pvc" method, this was previously called file
but has been renamed for clarity.

We now require Kubernetes 1.6 or later; remove the storage annotation
in favor of storageClassName.

Change-Id: I315eaf68937f91b56c1a26954072bda53767c606

commit_message:
Add $STACK_NAME input var

The stack name can now be overridden in the get-occ-config.sh script for
deployed-server's by setting the $STACK_NAME variable in the
environment.

Change-Id: Iecba21499b80e463b4c629be53c309996d39472d
Closes-Bug: #1686719
(cherry picked from commit e17590c69e599a3eb6b4a18d2d6dbef9dede9ea8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/37/467137/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: STACK_NAME=${STACK_NAME:-"overcloud"} while ! check_stack $STACK_NAME; do rg_stack=$(openstack stack resource show $STACK_NAME $role -c physical_resource_id -f value) rg_stack=$(openstack stack resource show $STACK_NAME $role -c physical_resource_id -f value)
deleted_lines: while ! check_stack overcloud; do rg_stack=$(openstack stack resource show overcloud $role -c physical_resource_id -f value) rg_stack=$(openstack stack resource show overcloud $role -c physical_resource_id -f value)

commit_message:
Prepare release notes for release 0.1.0

Adds prelude information for release 0.1.0 to release notes,
including information about currently supported projects
and backwards-compatibility information.

Change-Id: I82a47b61b3753892c2ed1466c07cbd226c40142b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/72/464072/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > This release indicates the first release for Patrole. Patrole currently supports RBAC testing for Cinder, Glance, Nova, Neutron and Keystone. Unlike Tempest, backwards-compatibility is not guaranteed nor currently tested, so OpenStack releases supported at this time include Pike. other: - | OpenSack releases supported at this time include Pike.

commit_message:
Fix cellsv2 cell0 database name

For some reason we were defaulting the name of the cell0 database
to nova_api_cell0 instead of nova_cell0. Devstack inherited that to
make things work, but we don't really want that. This patch makes us
use the proper name and create the cell0 mapping accordingly. As a
side effect, it also starts the process of unifying the cellsv1 and
cellsv2 paths by creating the cell0 mapping the same for both.

This is the grenade side of I4e7f6c5eaa068c98e5c4ef3feaee50d8e4f5d484.

The related Nova change which depends on this is:

I86797785f76c2c927a4db8fef72b8f8d986af6b9

We have to change the from-update/upgrade-nova script to explicitly
call map_cell0 so we can control the database connection used to
workaround the bug being fixed in that Nova change.

Conflicts:
        projects/60_nova/from-newton/upgrade-nova

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is simply due to from-newton not
being in stable/newton for grenade.

Related-Bug: #1656673

Change-Id: Ifdcd6a572dc0b42ba852241e22f6713cd2b084b0
(cherry picked from commit 74ce189956730572d0ef53c1fba4352cb230a279)

etcd3 as a new base service. We should drop zookeeper
and use etcd3 as the backend.

Since cinder is the first service for this tooz+etcd3 DLM
scenario and cinder uses eventlet we have cannnot use the
grpc based driver in tooz. So new CINDER_COORDINATION_URL
that defaults to the etcd3's grpc HTTP gateway based
tooz backend.

We need to hold this change until the tooz change (see
Depends-On) is available in a tooz release.

commit_message:
Get rid of zookeeper from devstack

In Ibbb430fb1dbf66942168e0cb52d990ab6a2eb8d7, we are adding
etcd3 as a new base service. We should drop zookeeper
and use etcd3 as the backend.

Since cinder is the first service for this tooz+etcd3 DLM
scenario and cinder uses eventlet we have cannnot use the
grpc based driver in tooz. So new CINDER_COORDINATION_URL
that defaults to the etcd3's grpc HTTP gateway based
tooz backend.

We need to hold this change until the tooz change (see
Depends-On) is available in a tooz release.

Depends-On: I6184ed193482dad9643ccb2b97133d4957485408
Change-Id: Ia187e1a86413edf25b909b6bb57e84fb4930a696

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4().hex with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function to generate uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ia64cceb8c17e8ee6cba83fceadf8510679c388d2
Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Cleared type restrictions for metadata option

It turns out that it is impossible to send unicode metadata
values with some cinder commands. The reason is a type restriction
that demands all values to be a 'str' type. As a result, it is
impossible to use unicode.

Change-Id: I1213b0d3b8177b670cd3e5d587fee9dabd971923
Closes-bug: #1693151

subject: Allow to disable optimizations for portability
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-24 20:42:47.000000000', 'files': ['configure.ac'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/liberasurecode/commit/0962144c51421a39be921876328bcecb912c7674', 'message': 'Allow to disable optimizations for portability

We're having trouble on Fedora when the build system runs
on Intel CPUs. The ./configure detects AVX instructions and
builds liberasurecode with them. The resulting library crashes
with SIGILL when users run it on ADM CPUs without AVX.

See the details here:
 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1454543

The patch allows to disable the optimizations, so that
distro packaging then can invoke this options and build
portable libraries.

For the record, "make test" runs about 16% slower on an Intel
CPU if optimizations are disabled. So, there's a measurable
performance impact. However, operators intersted in outright
performance might want to consider Erasure Coding implementations
other than the one  built-in into liberasurecode. The library
supports other back-ends that are significantly faster than
even optimized built-in code.

Change-Id: I09603b97ceeb833ba582cf3217e0be51c019d645
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to disable optimizations for portability

We're having trouble on Fedora when the build system runs
on Intel CPUs. The ./configure detects AVX instructions and
builds liberasurecode with them. The resulting library crashes
with SIGILL when users run it on ADM CPUs without AVX.

See the details here:
 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1454543

The patch allows to disable the optimizations, so that
distro packaging then can invoke this options and build
portable libraries.

For the record, "make test" runs about 16% slower on an Intel
CPU if optimizations are disabled. So, there's a measurable
performance impact. However, operators intersted in outright
performance might want to consider Erasure Coding implementations
other than the one  built-in into liberasurecode. The library
supports other back-ends that are significantly faster than
even optimized built-in code.

Change-Id: I09603b97ceeb833ba582cf3217e0be51c019d645
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/liberasurecode refs/changes/61/467761/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dnl but allow to disable all of this in order to build portable binaries AC_ARG_ENABLE([mmi], [ --disable-mmi do not use host-specific instructions], [case "${enableval}" in yes) mmi=true ;; no) mmi=false ;; *) AC_MSG_ERROR([bad value ${enableval} for --disable-mmi]) ;; esac],[mmi=true]) if test x$mmi = xtrue ; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="" $CC - -E -mmmx </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="-mmmx" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -mmmx]) fi $CC - -E -msse </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="$SUPPORTED_FLAGS -msse" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -msse]) fi $CC - -E -msse2 </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="$SUPPORTED_FLAGS -msse2" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -msse2]) fi $CC - -E -msse3 </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="$SUPPORTED_FLAGS -msse3" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -msse3]) fi $CC - -E -mssse3 </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="$SUPPORTED_FLAGS -mssse3" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -mssse3]) fi $CC - -E -msse4.1 </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="$SUPPORTED_FLAGS -msse4.1" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -msse4.1]) fi $CC - -E -msse4.2 </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="$SUPPORTED_FLAGS -msse4.2" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -msse4.2]) fi $CC - -E -mavx </dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 if [[ $? == "0" ]]; then SUPPORTED_FLAGS="$SUPPORTED_FLAGS -mavx" AC_MSG_RESULT([$CC supports -mavx]) fi # Detect the SIMD features supported by both the compiler and the CPU SIMD_FLAGS="" cat "$srcdir/get_flags_from_cpuid.c" \ | sed "s/FLAGSFROMAUTOCONF/${SUPPORTED_FLAGS}/" \ | $CC -x c -g - -o get_flags_from_cpuid if [[ -e ./get_flags_from_cpuid ]]; then chmod 755 get_flags_from_cpuid ./get_flags_from_cpuid rm ./get_flags_from_cpuid if [[ -e compiler_flags ]]; then SIMD_FLAGS=`cat compiler_flags` rm -f compiler_flags else AC_MSG_WARN([Could not run the CPUID detection program]) fi else AC_MSG_WARN([Could not compile the CPUID detection program]) fi AC_MSG_RESULT([Generating with SIMD flags: $SIMD_FLAGS]) CFLAGS="$CFLAGS $SIMD_FLAGS" fiAC_ARG_ENABLE(doxygen, [ --enable-doxygen use doxygen to build documentation (default=auto)],

commit_message:
Add data-plane-test script

In order to execute a data plan test during
major or minor upgrades, we copy over a script
for that purpose into the utility container.

Change-Id: I6fa200257a28b5fd76db83619308f7ed8075d975

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated tempest.test.attr

[1] moves the attr decorator from test.py to tempest/lib. So, all the
references to tempest.test has to be moved to tempest.lib.decorator.

commit_message:
attach_volume first check for existing attachment

Attach_volume has logic to check for an existing
attachment and return that attachment. Moved this
logic before checking to see if the status of the
volume is 'is-use'.

If a first call to attach fails with a time out,
cinderclient will retry the operation therefore
attach_volume needs to return the already existing
attachment if it exists for this instance.

Updated testcase.

Change-Id: I86d7f01b6aca376f9d8cf9de6cdfecd436726a0e
Closes-bug: 1681543

commit_message:
Fix share creation from snapshot

For the moment if we create share from snapshot from first attempt
we get share created from scratch, not from snapshot. This bug appered
after merge of [1] to manila and usage of 2.6+ microversion in Manila UI.
The reason why [1] had influence is in changed share view that became
incompatible with 'choices' in UI that depend on share type names.
So, start using correct field 'share_type_name', that will set default
value for share type omitting the need to set it manually all the time,
it also will trigger correct snapshot ID selection for request.
Also, fix logic for second+ attempt, where we were using different set
of data after failed attempt to submit request.

[1] I082bdac82c981adf733c709472ce1b9e26d5650b

Change-Id: I4b5a04ed16d8e579ad816e84ad907ddd97e13ac1
Closes-Bug: #1685657
(cherry picked from commit c458dff54c4f162c4a3ce7a743fc70d5595ede6a)

commit_message:
Remove any left-over tuskar packages on upgrade

During the instack install/upgrade undercloud run remove any
left over packages - see bug for more info. This cherrypick
is slightly different from ocata because here we don't have
the 'is upgrade' check/fact so we run the tuskar removal on
every instack run.

Closes-Bug: 1691744
Change-Id: I25dcdd82803f51db456213751849443715c8fe6f
(cherry picked from commit 7cbdf710a768dc4035da51465b75e276dc7bcee3)

added_lines: def _die_tuskar_die(): """Remove tuskar* packages Make sure to remove tuskar https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1691744 # openstack-[tuskar, tuskar-ui, tuskar-ui-extras] & python-tuskarclient """ try: _run_command(['sudo', 'yum', 'remove', '-y', '*tuskar*']) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: LOG.error('Error with tuskar removal task %s - continuing', e.output) _die_tuskar_die()

commit_message:
Require Port Pairs to share same correlation type

When creating Port Pair Groups, validation of each Port Pair's
correlation type will now occur.
Every Port Pair needs to share the same correlation type
when they get attached to a specific Port Pair Group.
This guarantees homogeneity in the composition of a Port Pair Group
and clarifies the definition and feature set of each hop of a chain.

Creating and Updating Port Pair Groups now verifies whether all PPs are
consistent with regards to the correlation type selected.

The workaround to achieve "homogeneous" next-hops in the OVS driver
introduced by Iebdfca5467ca33cfd9d93d55f47d6b57b79dffbe
has been removed, so were a couple of related tests.

Documentation has been updated.

Closes-Bug: #1692536

Change-Id: I80714f2661340c639a38162f3bfc22ab3e01a3c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/77/466777/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | When upgrading from Ocata (v4), existing Port Chains that have been deployed using Port Pair Groups that combine Port Pairs of different correlation types (within the same Port Pair Group) will render differently when using the OVS Driver. Whereas before all the Port Pairs would have their correlation ignored if at least one of them had ``correlation=None``, now the OVS driver will render each differently. Recreation of each Port Pair Group (that have inconsistent Port Pairs' correlations) is recommended - and only Port Pairs sharing the same correlation type will now be supported. fixes: - | When creating Port Pair Groups, validation of each Port Pair's correlation type will now occur. Every Port Pair needs to share the same correlation type when they get attached to a specific Port Pair Group. This guarantees homogeneity in the composition of a Port Pair Group and clarifies the definition and feature set of each hop of a chain.

commit_message:
automatically inject the global request id on every call

Use the current context to insert the global request ID into the headers
when making outgoing calls to enable cross-service log mapping.

Change-Id: I239d08742e47970fe246f2487a8545a9ae0afdfd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
support global_request_id in constructor

This allows a global_request_id to be created in the constructor which
will be passed on all subsequent calls to support cross service
request tracking.

Change-Id: Ib271ac01c2a4a36e611ae9181ae93305f2318680

commit_message:
run_tests: If repo is tests repo, symlink

In order to properly test changes to the tests repo
when using run_tests.sh, we symlink instead of clone.

Change-Id: Ia5aee41debc357f95709e9d004788998c5ce5065
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/01/468001/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## Shell Opts ----------------------------------------------------------------## Vars ---------------------------------------------------------------------- export WORKING_DIR=${WORKING_DIR:-$(pwd)} ## Main ---------------------------------------------------------------------- # The tests repo doesn't need a clone, we can just # symlink it. if [[ "$(basename ${WORKING_DIR})" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]]; then ln -s ${WORKING_DIR} ${WORKING_DIR}/tests/common else git clone \ https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests \ tests/common fi

commit_message:
Fix typo with DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG for nodepool-dsvm job

We want to preserve the previous settings for DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG,
so append not replace.

Change-Id: I8ecfc6871aa1bae09013337a8f9d812b83c41464
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
sync-test-repos.sh: Update topic and commit message

In preparation of using this script in the OpenStack CI propose job,
we update the topic branch and the commit message to match those
in the Jenkins job. This way we can use this script to update reviews
which were proposed by the Jenkins job.

Change-Id: I35a952af4f2d8147060412995c5f51cc7c039324

subject: Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 03:27:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/626043554adf0e65b9ca99f52e7bbaf87f5bccf9', 'message': "Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call
to oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3
porting standard [1]. Use base64 encoding takes 8-bit binary
byte data and encodes it. On Python3, A string is a sequence
of Unicode characters thus base64 has no idea what to do with
Unicode data, it's not 8-bit[2]. We use oslo_serialization.base64
for both python2 and python3.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8908287/base64-encoding-in-python-3

Change-Id: Ie46169e07750f83d26f3b5efe128c3fccaa8080c

"}]
commit_message:
Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call
to oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3
porting standard [1]. Use base64 encoding takes 8-bit binary
byte data and encodes it. On Python3, A string is a sequence
of Unicode characters thus base64 has no idea what to do with
Unicode data, it's not 8-bit[2]. We use oslo_serialization.base64
for both python2 and python3.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8908287/base64-encoding-in-python-3

Change-Id: Ie46169e07750f83d26f3b5efe128c3fccaa8080c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/413885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_serialization import base64 pub_data = base64.decode_as_bytes(public_key.split(' ')[1]) private_key = base64.encode_as_bytes(out)
deleted_lines: import base64 pub_data = base64.b64decode(public_key.split(' ')[1]) private_key = base64.b64encode(out)

commit_message:
Don't pass sqlite_db in db_options.set_defaults()

The option sqlite_db was deprecated and removed by
Id269d921e40edf95eb977b011f1753f633b79d18

As we passed it as positional argument, another max_pool_size
var was set automatically.
This patch removes dropped sqlite_db option.

Change-Id: Icdd89453ec3ebecd8375a5f2efd1a0d4bf6b4064
Closes-Bug: #1676809
(cherry picked from commit d31d984871a03c3e7cc4be85a0f2fb12bda5dc7e)

- Fix proxy server puppet module location

commit_message:
Include mongodb in scenario002 job

Since we disable mongodb by default, zaqar needs it in sceanio002 job.
Lets explicitly include it so it doesnt fail with:

Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find data item mongodb_node_ips
in any Hiera data file and no default supplied at
 /etc/puppet/modules/tripleo/manifests/profile/base/zaqar.pp

commit_message:
PowerVM Driver: console

This change set adds the VNC console support for the PowerVM driver.

Change-Id: Ic7bee711e9223d4dc4fa4a0911c3fbca34bc54c9
Partially-Implements: blueprint powervm-nova-compute-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/02/409402/33 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from pypowervm.tasks import vterm as pvm_vtermfrom nova import conf as cfg from nova.console import type as console_typeCONF = cfg.CONF def get_vnc_console(self, context, instance): """Get connection info for a vnc console. :param context: security context :param instance: nova.objects.instance.Instance :return: An instance of console.type.ConsoleVNC """ self._log_operation('get_vnc_console', instance) lpar_uuid = vm.get_pvm_uuid(instance) # Build the connection to the VNC. host = CONF.vnc.vncserver_proxyclient_address # TODO(thorst, efried) Add the x509 certificate support when it lands try: # Open up a remote vterm port = pvm_vterm.open_remotable_vnc_vterm( self.adapter, lpar_uuid, host, vnc_path=lpar_uuid) except Exception as err: # If the LPAR was not found, then give a more descriptive message if isinstance(err, pvm_exc.HttpError): if err.response.status == 404: msg = _("Unable to open console since virtual machine " "%s does not exist.") % instance['display_name'] raise exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable(message=msg) # Otherwise wrapper the error in an exception that can be handled raise exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable( message=_("Unable to open console. Error is: %s") % err) # Note that the VNC viewer will wrap the internal_access_path with # the HTTP content. return console_type.ConsoleVNC(host=host, port=port, internal_access_path=lpar_uuid)

subject: bindep-fallbacks for openSUSE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-25 08:59:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/c805325889bc7e129ddd0d4097318d97b9ed51e5', 'message': "bindep-fallbacks for openSUSE

Currently the bindep-fallback file assumes that platform:rpm
is only exectuted on Red Hat - family operating systems. On openSUSE
some of the package names are different (for legacy or consistency
reasons). Adjust by making the filters more specific.

mongodb is currently missing from opensuse 42.2 (new in 42.3), so
let's see if we can get away without it.

Change-Id: Iea28fb5a6805c4d015ce4d258fbf23153a45f49d

commit_message:
bindep-fallbacks for openSUSE

Currently the bindep-fallback file assumes that platform:rpm
is only exectuted on Red Hat - family operating systems. On openSUSE
some of the package names are different (for legacy or consistency
reasons). Use platform:suse for matching SUSE package naming scheme.

mongodb and liberasurecode is currently missing from opensuse 42.2 (new in 42.3),
so let's see if we can get away without it. currently those are
blacklisted via !platform:opensuseproject and can hopefully be changed
to !platform:opensuseproject-42.2 once 42.3 is released and bindep
parsing bug related to the "." in the platform is fixed.

Change-Id: Iea28fb5a6805c4d015ce4d258fbf23153a45f49d

subject: DVR: Add forwarding routes based on address_scopes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 20:23:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/03043c9dac81deb070152ff9a57ea0d6dd59f8a8', 'message': "(WIP)DVR: Enable/Disable snat redirect rules based on snat state

When we create agent gateway port on all the nodes irrespective
of the floatingips we can basically use that agent gateway port to
forward traffic in and out of the nodes and we don't need to depend
on the snat gateway port on the dvr_snat node, unless enable_snat
is true.

If a gateway is configured with enable_snat false, then we don't
need to add in the redirect rules to the snat_node in the router
namespace.

The redirect rules can be added or removed based on the snat state.

Change-Id: Iaf6d3b38b1fb45772cf0b88706586c057ddb0230
Related-Bug: #1577488
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-13 03:26:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a849107e9c46169da8ec4f3557fcda6deab4692b', 'message': "(WIP)DVR: Enable/Disable snat redirect rules based on snat state

When we create agent gateway port on all the nodes irrespective
of the floatingips we can basically use that agent gateway port to
forward traffic in and out of the nodes and we don't need to depend
on the snat gateway port on the dvr_snat node, unless enable_snat
is true.

If a gateway is configured with enable_snat false, then we don't
need to add in the redirect rules to the snat_node in the router
namespace.

The redirect rules can be added or removed based on the snat state.

Change-Id: Iaf6d3b38b1fb45772cf0b88706586c057ddb0230
Related-Bug: #1577488
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-15 21:55:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/aa78f4cdaa8255daf43316aa940aaf6d4ac26687', 'message': '(WIP)DVR: Enable/Disable snat redirect rules based on address_scopes

When we create agent gateway port on all the nodes irrespective
of the floatingips we can basically use that agent gateway port to
forward traffic in and out of the nodes if the address_scopes match.

If a gateway is configured and if it has internal ports that belong
to the same address_scopes then no need to add the redirect rules.

Change-Id: Iaf6d3b38b1fb45772cf0b88706586c057ddb0230
Related-Bug: #1577488
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-18 22:37:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/67c8d34102645416db5ff8a1860d64b410ea3d48', 'message': '(WIP)DVR: Add forwarding routes based on address_scopes

When we create agent gateway port on all the nodes irrespective
of the floatingips we can basically use that agent gateway port to
forward traffic in and out of the nodes if the address_scopes match.

If a gateway is configured and if it has internal ports that belong
to the same address_scopes then no need to add the redirect rules.
At the same we should also add a static route in the fip namespace
for every interface that is connected to the router that belongs to
the same address scope.

Change-Id: Iaf6d3b38b1fb45772cf0b88706586c057ddb0230
Closes-Bug: #1577488

If a gateway is configured and if it has internal ports that belong
to the same address_scopes then no need to add the redirect rules.
At the same we should also add a static route in the fip namespace
for every interface that is connected to the router that belongs to
the same address scope.

to the same address_scopes then no need to add the redirect rules.
At the same we should also add a static route in the fip namespace
for every interface that is connected to the router that belongs to

commit_message:
DVR: Add forwarding routes based on address_scopes

When we create agent gateway port on all the nodes irrespective
of the floatingips we can basically use that agent gateway port to
forward traffic in and out of the nodes if the address_scopes match,
since we don't need SNAT functionality if address scopes match.

If a gateway is configured and if it has internal ports that belong
to the same address_scopes then no need to add the redirect rules.
At the same we should also add a static route in the fip namespace
for every interface that is connected to the router that belongs to
the same address scope.

Change-Id: Iaf6d3b38b1fb45772cf0b88706586c057ddb0230
Closes-Bug: #1577488
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/62/355062/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not self._snat_enabled: return # Clean up the cached arp entries related to the port subnet for subnet in port['subnets']: self._delete_arp_cache_for_internal_port(subnet) if not self._snat_enabled: return def enable_snat_redirect_rules(self): for p in self.internal_ports: gateway = self.get_snat_port_for_internal_port(p) if not gateway: continue interface_name = self.get_internal_device_name(p['id']) self._snat_redirect_add(gateway, p, interface_name) def disable_snat_redirect_rules(self): for p in self.internal_ports: # NOTE: When removing the gateway port, pass in the snat_port # cache along with the current ports. gateway = self.get_snat_port_for_internal_port(p, self.snat_ports) if not gateway: continue internal_interface = self.get_internal_device_name(p['id']) self._snat_redirect_remove(gateway, p, internal_interface) if self._snat_enabled: self.disable_snat_redirect_rules() # Handle gateway update cases with snat_enabled or # snat disabled to add the snat redirect rules. if self._snat_enabled: self.enable_snat_redirect_rules() else: self.disable_snat_redirect_rules()
deleted_lines: # Clean up the cached arp entries related to the port subnet for subnet in port['subnets']: self._delete_arp_cache_for_internal_port(subnet) for p in self.internal_ports: gateway = self.get_snat_port_for_internal_port(p) id_name = self.get_internal_device_name(p['id']) if gateway: self._snat_redirect_add(gateway, p, id_name) for p in self.internal_ports: # NOTE: When removing the gateway port, pass in the snat_port # cache along with the current ports. gateway = self.get_snat_port_for_internal_port(p, self.snat_ports) if not gateway: continue internal_interface = self.get_internal_device_name(p['id']) self._snat_redirect_remove(gateway, p, internal_interface)

subject: Slow down keyboard input on Windows
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-25 10:32:26.000000000', 'files': ['labs/stacktrain/core/keycodes.py', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/functions-host.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/a09e3fdb59914687aba0f6c47b8e0cac9e8134ab', 'message': 'Slow down keyboard input on Windows

The Windows batch files do not have to turn each character of the
boot parameters into a keyboard scancode before sending them to the
hypervisor. On some Windows hosts, the keycodes are sent too fast,
overruning the keyboard buffer. Characters are lost and the build fails.

This patch adds a few seconds to the basedisk build on Windows to avoid
this problem. Whenever a number of characters are sent, we sleep for a
second, giving the keyboard buffer time to be read.

Change-Id: I8fd952c020bd021538dab81acd15bc5908498cdf
'}]
commit_message:
Slow down keyboard input on Windows

The Windows batch files do not have to turn each character of the
boot parameters into a keyboard scancode before sending them to the
hypervisor. On some Windows hosts, the keycodes are sent too fast,
overruning the keyboard buffer. Characters are lost and the build fails.

This patch adds a few seconds to the basedisk build on Windows to avoid
this problem. Whenever a number of characters are sent, we sleep for a
second, giving the keyboard buffer time to be read.

Change-Id: I8fd952c020bd021538dab81acd15bc5908498cdf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/87/467987/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local cnt=0 # Inject sleep into the wbatch files because the Windows batch file # is sometimes _too_ efficient and overruns the keyboard input buffer if [[ $((cnt % 50)) -eq 0 ]]; then OSBASH= ${WBATCH:-:} conditional_sleep 1 fi cnt=$((cnt + 1))

commit_message:
Deprecate Nova specific compute_request_id middleware

Nova has it's own copy of the compute_request_id which is identical to
oslo.middleware's version, for no reason. This deprecates it so it can
be removed in future.

Change-Id: I66488fe5ce11775d7d7e52919825adf75689409d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/463840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This is the deprecated class in Nova, which we can't remove without deprecation because once this code is deleted people's paste pipeline will break. Remove this in Queens. from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_log import versionutils from oslo_middleware import request_id LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) MSG = """api-paste.ini contains `compute_req_id` in API pipeline. This will be removed in Queens. Please replace this with oslo's `request_id` module.""" class ComputeReqIdMiddleware(request_id.RequestId): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(ComputeReqIdMiddleware, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) versionutils.report_deprecated_feature(LOG, MSG)
deleted_lines: Using this middleware provides a convenient way to attach the x-compute-request-id to only v2 responses. Previously, this header was set in api/openstack/wsgi.py Responses for v2.1 API are taken care of by the request_id middleware provided in oslo. from oslo_context import context from oslo_middleware import base import webob.dec ENV_REQUEST_ID = 'openstack.request_id' HTTP_RESP_HEADER_REQUEST_ID = 'x-compute-request-id' class ComputeReqIdMiddleware(base.Middleware): @webob.dec.wsgify def __call__(self, req): req_id = context.generate_request_id() req.environ[ENV_REQUEST_ID] = req_id response = req.get_response(self.application) if HTTP_RESP_HEADER_REQUEST_ID not in response.headers: response.headers.add(HTTP_RESP_HEADER_REQUEST_ID, req_id) return response

commit_message:
Tests: Fix Blockbridge hash randomization failure

This test fails if hash randomization is enabled.

commit_message:
Fix restore nova instance fail

Currently, restore nova feature is broken, it is because the
latest python-novaclient has removed the 'nova.network'. This
patch use python-neutronclient instead and will fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ifb2ab820a3cfc347d86a1b0b2fac79217752d227
Closes-Bug: #1693437
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/17/467917/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutronclient.v2_0 import client as neutron_client self.neutron = None self.neutron_version = kwargs.pop('neutron_api_version', 2) def create_neutron(self): """ Use pre-initialized session to create an instance of neutron client. :return: neutronclient instance """ self.neutron = neutron_client.Client(session=self.sess, **self.client_kwargs) return self.neutron def get_neutron(self): """ Get neutronclient instance :return: neutronclient instance """ if not self.neutron: self.neutron = self.create_neutron() return self.neutron

commit_message:
[install-guide] Correct RABBIT_PASS description

Modified the RABBIT_PASS description to state user as openstack
instead of guest. This makes it consistent with the RabbitMQ
example on Message queue page.

Change-Id: Iff86bcd91ca96e1ead7dc4474ff879f6b5e0ae8f
Closes-Bug: #1693031

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/70/467870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: characters. See [2]_. * Add tags field as part of default response when listing projects and showing a single project.* Tags are URL-safe and should match the following regular expression: .. code:: bash [\w\@\!\#\$\%\^\&\*\(\)\;\<\>\:\.\"\'\|\+\-\?\=]+ To request the list of projects that have at least one tag from a given list, the ``tags-any`` argument should be set to the list of tags, separated``not-tags`` argument should be set to the list of tags, separated by commas. In this situation, the tags given must be absent for a project to be included in the query result. Example that returns the projects thattags, the ``not-tags-any`` argument should be set to the list of tags, separated by commas. In this situation, as long as one of the given tags is present, the project will be included in the query result. Example that returns the projects that do not have the foo tag, and do not haveThe ``tags``, ``tags-any``, ``not-tags`` and ``not-tags-any`` arguments can .. [2] `<https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/approved/tag-instances.html#rest-api-impact>`_
deleted_lines: characters. * Add tags field as part of default response when listing projects.Regex that matches any VALID tag would be: .. code-block:: bash \w+|\@|\!|\#|\$|\%|\^|\&|\*|\(|\)|\;|\<|\>|\:|\.|\"|\'|\||\+|\-|\?|\= To request the list of projects that have one OR more of a list of given tags, the `tags-any` argument should be set to the list of tags, separated`not-tags` argument should be set to the list of tags, separated by commas. In this situation, only the projects that do not have any of the given tags will be included in the query results. Example that returns the projects thattags, the `not-tags-any` argument should be set to the list of tags, separated by commas. In this situation, only the projects that do not have at least one of the given tags will be included in the query result. Example that returns the projects that do not have the foo tag, or do not haveThe `tags`, `tags-any`, `not-tags` and `not-tags-any` arguments can

commit_message:
Remove duplicate PreConfig definition

We had two exactly the same definitions of PreConfig in
docker_steps.j2.yaml. We should remove one of them.

I chose to remove the first definition, as the 2nd definition is amended
by change I674a4d9d2c77d1f6fbdb0996f6c9321848e32662, so we'll avoid a
conflict.

Change-Id: If65e30daefcf6552e085c7648c6691b7068834d4

commit_message:
Fix bare jinja variable pam_password_file

The pam_password_variable didn't have jinja tags around it and it
wasn't being handled correctly. This patch fixes the bug and makes
the task name easier to read.

Closes-Bug: 1693343
Change-Id: Ie469c32a71c3c0e1b381739290ffb608bb04a21c

commit_message:
Cleanup Galera client role

This patch does a few cleanups:

  * Removes jinja2 content from when
  * Switches to package module to install pkgs
  * Pass package lists as a list (not with_items)

Change-Id: I50e7029053fb21cedcee6a8e122f0442f1d587ff

commit_message:
Revert "Use a custom git checkout in developer mode"

We are adding a more generic approach to setting up developer mode for
testing, in I774343234a25063eb320cac85ba696d908f0a416. This will revert
the initial POC work that was done on the Keystone role, in favour of
the more generic approach.

This reverts commit c8631347e729f9a21ec4f94f1a001776645dde5e.

Change-Id: I62d62e24123bae7b59deb6f0508608fdc1472481

added_lines: import copy @ddt.ddt class RequiredAPIVersionsValidatorTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(RequiredAPIVersionsValidatorTestCase, self).setUp() self.config = copy.deepcopy(config) self.credentials = copy.deepcopy(credentials) def _get_keystone_v2_mock_client(self): keystone = mock.Mock() del keystone.projects keystone.tenants = mock.Mock() return keystone def _get_keystone_v3_mock_client(self): keystone = mock.Mock() del keystone.tenants keystone.projects = mock.Mock() return keystone @ddt.unpack @ddt.data( {"versions": [2.0], "err_msg": "Task was designed to be used with" " keystone V2.0, but V3 is selected."}, {"versions": [3], "err_msg": "Task was designed to be used with" " keystone V3, but V2.0 is selected."}, {"versions": [2.0, 3], "err_msg": None} ) def test_validate_keystone(self, versions, err_msg): validator = validators.RequiredAPIVersionsValidator("keystone", versions) clients = self.credentials["openstack"]["users"][0][ "credential"].clients() clients.keystone.return_value = self._get_keystone_v3_mock_client() result = validator.validate(self.config, self.credentials, None, None) if result: self.assertTrue(result) self.assertEqual(err_msg, result.msg) clients.keystone.return_value = self._get_keystone_v2_mock_client() result = validator.validate(self.config, self.credentials, None, None) if result: self.assertTrue(result) self.assertEqual(err_msg, result.msg) @ddt.unpack @ddt.data( {"nova": 2, "versions": [2], "err_msg": None}, {"nova": 3, "versions": [2], "err_msg": "Task was designed to be used with nova V2, " "but V3 is selected."}, {"nova": None, "versions": [2], "err_msg": "Unable to determine the API version."}, {"nova": 2, "versions": [2, 3], "err_msg": None}, {"nova": 4, "versions": [2, 3], "err_msg": "Task was designed to be used with nova V2, 3, " "but V4 is selected."} ) def test_validate_nova(self, nova, versions, err_msg): validator = validators.RequiredAPIVersionsValidator("nova", versions) clients = self.credentials["openstack"]["users"][0][ "credential"].clients() clients.nova.choose_version.return_value = nova result = validator.validate(self.config, self.credentials, None, None) if result: self.assertTrue(result) self.assertEqual(err_msg, result.msg) @ddt.unpack @ddt.data({"version": 2, "err_msg": None}, {"version": 3, "err_msg": "Task was designed to be used with " "nova V3, but V2 is selected."}) def test_validate_context(self, version, err_msg): validator = validators.RequiredAPIVersionsValidator("nova", [version]) config = {"context": {"api_versions": {"nova": {"version": 2}}}} result = validator.validate(config, self.credentials, None, None) if result: self.assertTrue(result) self.assertEqual(err_msg, result.msg)

commit_message:
Install the test profile on Gentoo too

As with all other distros, make sure the packages flagged for the
test profile are also passed to emerge on Gentoo in the
install-distro-packages.sh script.

commit_message:
Bump pydot2 to pydot3

pydot2 is incompatible with python3[1]. Bumping the pydot release (through
the test-requirements.txt) rather than pinning basepython to fix this.

Also updating the states.svg with the tox -egenstates result of running
pydot3

[1] https://github.com/erocarrera/pydot/issues/107

Change-Id: I9aa0e701af3915b39e1a5681c2105a6afb687dd2
Depends-On: I82e3651eefd3186c9e131b0db29a328967fb3161

commit_message:
Spec: Add protected filter to image-list call

Change-Id: I9b57dccc18e7c7cb133cf0d1226a3f6bd35cb39f
APIImpact: new query parameter to existing call
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/60/451560/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================= Add 'protected' filter to image-list call ========================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/add-protected-filter Images contain a boolean 'protected' field. Filtering on this field in the image-list request is not currently supported. Operators and users who make use of the 'protected' field to prevent accidental deletion of images, however, would find such filtering useful. Not supporting filtering on this field is counterintuitive as Glance supports filtering on all other image fields. Problem description =================== Use cases: * An End User wants to list protected images that are accessible to that end user. * An End User wants to list non-protected images that are accessible to that end user. Proposed change =============== Add code so that when 'protected=<value>' is included in a query string on the image-list call, the value is converted to a boolean, making it suitable for database filtering (the 'protected' field is a boolean in the database backend). For a good user experience, a liberal set of values for this parameter should be recognized, for example, 'true' or 'false' in any case combination; 'yes' or 'no' in any case combination; and 1 or 0. This can be accomplished by using the oslo string utilities, which contains a function ``bool_from_string`` that converts strings to an appropriate boolean value [OSL1]_. Using the oslo library has an additional bonus in that the usage will be consistent across other OpenStack projects. The ``bool_from_string`` function has a 'strict' option that can be used to force the function to raise a ValueError when a non-recognized value (for example, 'protected=Fred') is passed. In such a case, the API would return a 400 to indicate a bad request. To summarize: 1. Introduce a new query parameter to the ``GET v2/images`` call, namely, ``protected``. 2. The parameter will act as a filter on the 'protected' field of an Image. 3. The set of values for the parameter will be permissive, that is, it will accept strings that can reasonably be interpreted as True or False, as defined by oslo string utilities [OSL1]_ in "strict mode". These are: * strings case-insensitively matching 't','true', 'on', 'y', 'yes', or '1' are considered True * strings case-insensitively matching 'f', 'false', 'off', 'n', 'no', or '0' are considered False 4. Unrecognized values will result in a 400 (Bad Request) response with an appropriate message. 5. When the ``protected`` query parameter is not present, no filtering will be done on the 'protected' field of Images. (In other words, there's no default value.) Alternatives ------------ 1. Do nothing. This isn't really an option, because even though 'protected' is not currently supported as a filter, image-list calls passing a value for 'protected' in the query string are accepted and do have an effect (the API behaves as if ``protected=False`` has been specified). This behavior appears weird to end users. 2. Implement the filter, but be extremely strict, that is, accept only 'true' or 'false' in that exact case combination. This doesn't seem very user friendly. 3. Implement the filter, but be extremely lax, that is, any value that isn't mapped to the boolean value True by the oslo ``bool_from_string`` function would be considered False. This isn't very user friendly either, for example, a French language speaker applying the query filter 'protected=oui' will receive the complement of what was requested. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- This is a very minor modification to the ``GET v2/images`` call. The only changes are: * Parameters which can be passed via the URL now include ``protected``. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- The only impact on python-glanceclient is that the command ``glance image-list --property protected=true`` will now work correctly. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: - fengzhr Other contributors: - rosmaita - dharinic Work Items ---------- * Implement the change roughly along the lines of Patch Set 7 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449108/ * Update the api-ref * Write a release note Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Functional tests consistent with the current image-list filtering tests. Documentation Impact ==================== Small addition to the v2 image-list documentation in the api-ref. References ========== .. [OSL1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.utils/tree/oslo_utils/strutils.py

commit_message:
Fix gate issue in scenario test

The host reservation scenario test fails because of a bug in Nova:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1693438. This patch is a temporary
workaround until the issue is fixed in Nova.

Change-Id: I50b6c92ab930f70479f4524ea675509019567f6a

commit_message:
Remove log translations

The i18n team has decided not to translate the logs because it seems
like it not very useful; operators prefer to have them in English so
that they can search for those strings on the internet.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/thread.html#113365.

Change-Id: I4418a388934ef58acb70c7f637b0236a6ccc7fe6
Closes-Bug: #1682101

commit_message:
Modify regex pattern used to validate node ids

We have been changing the ironic-ui client api to accept both node
uuids and names (to be consistent with the ironic client); however,
the urls defining the rest endpoints only accepted uuids. This
change uses a logical-name-pattern to accept both uuids and names.

Change-Id: I288d8e3c4d949e4787f67b62d87372fec539dd32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-ui refs/changes/82/465982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN = '[a-zA-Z0-9-._~]+' url_regex = r'ironic/nodes/(?P<node_id>{})$'.format(LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN) url_regex = r'ironic/nodes/(?P<node_id>{})/states/power$'. \ format(LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN) url_regex = r'ironic/nodes/(?P<node_uuid>{})/states/provision$'. \ format(LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN) url_regex = r'ironic/nodes/(?P<node_uuid>{})/states/console$'. \ format(LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN) url_regex = r'ironic/nodes/(?P<node_id>{})/maintenance$'. \ format(LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN) url_regex = r'ironic/nodes/(?P<node_id>{})/validate$'. \ format(LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN) url_regex = r'ironic/nodes/(?P<node_id>{})/boot_device$'. \ format(LOGICAL_NAME_PATTERN)

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated.
This removes all use of the _LE, _LI, and _LW
translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Ifbae7a94b99302dcfa5c8c962a962b21358ed666

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

commit_message:
Remove BEFORE_UPDATE event from _subnet_gateway_ip_update

After patch [1] merged, BEFORE_UPDATE event is no longer needed, and
routes operations can be move to one transaction to make them atomic.
This patch also changes method name to _subnet_update.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/464775/

Change-Id: I08b1a149df69efc7786b59a6595141ea51b49e2d
Closes-Bug: #1691422
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/39/465839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @registry.receives(resources.SUBNET, [events.AFTER_UPDATE]) def _subnet_update(resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): current = kwargs['subnet'] orig_gw_ip = orig['gateway_ip'] current_gw_ip = current['gateway_ip'] if orig_gw_ip == current_gw_ip: gw_ports = l3plugin._plugin.get_ports(context, filters={ 'network_id': [orig['network_id']], 'fixed_ips': {'subnet_id': [orig['id']]}, router_ids = set([port['device_id'] for port in gw_ports]) remove = [{'destination': '0.0.0.0/0', 'nexthop': orig_gw_ip} ] if orig_gw_ip else [] add = [{'destination': '0.0.0.0/0', 'nexthop': current_gw_ip} ] if current_gw_ip else [] for router_id in router_ids: l3plugin._update_lrouter_routes(context, router_id, add, remove)
deleted_lines: @registry.receives(resources.SUBNET, [events.BEFORE_UPDATE, events.AFTER_UPDATE]) def _subnet_gateway_ip_update(resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): if event == events.BEFORE_UPDATE: new_ip = kwargs['request'].get('gateway_ip', orig['gateway_ip']) else: new_ip = kwargs['subnet']['gateway_ip'] if new_ip == orig['gateway_ip']: network_id = orig['network_id'] subnet_id = orig['id'] gw_ports = l3plugin._plugin.get_ports(context, filters={ 'network_id': [network_id], 'fixed_ips': {'subnet_id': [subnet_id]}, router_ids = set(port['device_id'] for port in gw_ports) gateway_ip = l3plugin._plugin.get_subnet(context, subnet_id). \ get('gateway_ip') add = [] remove = [] if event == events.AFTER_UPDATE: add = [{'destination': '0.0.0.0/0', 'nexthop': gateway_ip}] elif event == events.BEFORE_UPDATE: remove = [{'destination': '0.0.0.0/0', 'nexthop': gateway_ip}] for router_id in router_ids: l3plugin._update_lrouter_routes(None, router_id, add, remove)

commit_message:
Add more details to example template

A minor update to existing example template.
Added details about what the example template does and what to
expect from the example template and cluster created based on this
example template.

Change-Id: I53c4b9d0921555fd35fb89a5ef1f8696720c4eda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/31/467031/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The purpose of this example template is to demonstrate working with cluster templates using magnum service. The Heat template used in this example (example.yaml) provisions a single server instance and does not produce a usable cluster.

commit_message:
WIP: update bindep_fallback.txt for opensuse

Because platform:rpm is shared with opensuse, we'll need to be
explicit on which platform a package should be installed in. Other
wise, it is possible said packages does not exist on the other
platform.

Change-Id: I4850c9c6844515f4a106f231cc4a81eebcffc956
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Serial-over-LAN enable/disable test

Change-Id: Icc6ea53bfa1ce96d547e969017721f8e5bede541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/03/364303/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging from ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario import baremetal_manager import requests from tempest import config from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class BaremetalSerialOverLan(baremetal_manager.BaremetalScenarioTest, manager.NetworkScenarioTest): """Tests for `Serial Over Lan` ironic feature""" @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(BaremetalSerialOverLan, cls).setUpClass() _, body = cls.baremetal_client.list_nodes() for port, node in enumerate(body['nodes'], 10000): cls.enable_ipmi_terminal_port(node, port) @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): _, body = cls.baremetal_client.list_nodes() for node in body['nodes']: try: cls.disable_ipmi_terminal_port(node) except lib_exc.BadRequest: pass super(BaremetalSerialOverLan, cls).tearDownClass() def wait_console_state(self, node, enabled=True): def _get_console_state(): try: _, body = self.baremetal_client.get_console(node['uuid']) except lib_exc.NotFound: pass return body['console_enabled'] == enabled if (not test.call_until_true(_get_console_state, CONF.baremetal.association_timeout, 1)): msg = ('Timed out waiting to Ironic node "{0[uuid]}"" ' 'console_enabled to be "{1}"'.format(node, enabled)) raise lib_exc.TimeoutException(msg) @test.idempotent_id('d1be0cbd-743f-47df-b6d4-b563a712879f') @test.services('baremetal', 'compute', 'image', 'network') def test_enable_disable_serial_console(self): """Check enabling serial console on ironic node: * Boot instance * Enable console mode on node with booted instance * Check that console is enabled and console_info contains console url * Check that console url is available and return HTTP 200 status * Disable console mode * Check that console is disabled and console_info is None * Check that console_url is unreachable * Delete instance """ # Boot instance keypair = self.create_keypair() instance, node = self.boot_instance(clients=self.manager, keypair=keypair) # Set console mode to `true` self.baremetal_client.set_console_mode(node['uuid'], True) self.wait_console_state(node, enabled=True) # Check console is available _, body = self.baremetal_client.get_console(node['uuid']) self.assertIn('url', body['console_info']) console_url = body['console_info']['url'] response = requests.get(console_url) self.assertEqual(response.status_code, 200, "Node console is unavailable") # Set console mode to `false` self.baremetal_client.set_console_mode(node['uuid'], False) self.wait_console_state(node, enabled=False) # Check console is not available _, body = self.baremetal_client.get_console(node['uuid']) self.assertIsNone(body['console_info']) self.assertRaises(requests.exceptions.ConnectionError, requests.get, console_url) self.terminate_instance(instance=instance)

commit_message:
Improve variable naming consistency

Updates the entire module with the following:
  - CamelCasing for class names and RST block indentifiers.
  - snake_casing for variables, functions and methods.
  - Ignoring thirdparty and library modules.
  - Logger and Exception/Custom Exceptions are following CamelCasing.

Change-Id: Ib7d26045f367d6e2f8eb6abbfda4fb37ae71fa86

commit_message:
Update line length to 79 characters

The cursor at the end will be on the 80th character, which will be the
new line character in reality, this should not be confused with.

Change-Id: Iff89c78a504927f1a1d914bb19df4074f2c31df4

commit_message:
bug-tagging: add deployment-time tag

Adding deployment-time to track bugs that affect the Deployment time, so
we can easily list all of them and create some working group working on
this topic.

Change-Id: Ibaf0f349f1f4185f03134c92eb92211727ebd3ec

commit_message:
Make console logging optional

Console logging is useful when using the tool interactively, but
generats extra noise when using in a gating scenario. Move this into a
flag that enables it should it be necessary.

As part of this, the failure rate will be printed to stdout regardless
of console logging's status. This is so automated tools can use the
returned number to check for passing or failing.

Also, remove the old `configure_logging` function that was no longer in
use.

Change-Id: I55d410e6d504b03993f90cfd38dcd938390d02d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/39/467839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix Javascript unassignable errors

Replaced several instances of the action directive with HTML list-item/
anchor equivalents. Because the action uses two-way bound scope
variables for "callback" and "item" arguments you cannot specify a
literal value as an argument to the callback function. Two-way bound
variables must be assignable. In my mind there is some question as
to whether the action directive should have been implemented in this
way, but for now I am proposing to use an ng-click directive within
an anchor to implement callback functionality when a literal argument
is needed.

Change-Id: I2baf17c2784faeb92da362544c53e444e6d01afc

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary escaping of volume name

Variable contents in Django templates are escaped by default, no need
to do it explicitly.

Change-Id: I0b9619b7b1605bcdb17fe3b7204bf6e6c2520454
Closes-Bug: #1597751

subject: Fix when clause in pymysql check on CentOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 18:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/4200c39121c7c140378a472c5fa9212f18e15079', 'message': 'Fix when clause in pymysql check on CentOS

The when clause that checks if pymysql should be installed from pip
is incorrectly doing an integer comparison against a string value
from the ansible_distribution_major_version variable.

This change resolves that issue by using the version_compare() cast
like was being done for Ubuntu.

Related to: #1665279

Change-Id: Ia3a4bf789cc8e19d7b1f7854cb3ae71c2b8d47e1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix when clause in pymysql check on CentOS

The when clause that checks if pymysql should be installed from pip
is incorrectly doing an integer comparison against a string value
from the ansible_distribution_major_version variable.

This change resolves that issue by using the version_compare() cast
like was being done for Ubuntu.

Related to: #1665279

Change-Id: Ia3a4bf789cc8e19d7b1f7854cb3ae71c2b8d47e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/57/467357/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use charms.openstack charmhelpers test_mocks

Every reactive charm that uses charms.openstack and implements unit
testing needs to mock charmhelpers, as otherwise the tests blow up.
This patch uses the mocking of charmhelpers in charms.openstack so that
a charm layer can just import test_mocks and charmhelpers will be mocked
out along with setting up a default
charmhelpers.c.o.u.OPENSTACK_RELEASES so that when an OpenStackCharm()
derived charm class won't fail on definition.

Change-Id: I453d1f57d723a2519f6191f585fa378150fc61d8
Related-Bug: #1693017
Depends-On: I5ac40617ee30e5f421ec16fc7592177a5e6aa166
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-openvswitch-odl refs/changes/14/468014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import mock# also stops sideeffects from occuring. charmhelpers = mock.MagicMock() apt_pkg = mock.MagicMock() sys.modules['apt_pkg'] = apt_pkg sys.modules['charmhelpers'] = charmhelpers sys.modules['charmhelpers.core'] = charmhelpers.core sys.modules['charmhelpers.core.decorators'] = charmhelpers.core.decorators sys.modules['charmhelpers.core.hookenv'] = charmhelpers.core.hookenv sys.modules['charmhelpers.core.host'] = charmhelpers.core.host sys.modules['charmhelpers.core.unitdata'] = charmhelpers.core.unitdata sys.modules['charmhelpers.core.templating'] = charmhelpers.core.templating sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib'] = charmhelpers.contrib sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib.openstack'] = charmhelpers.contrib.openstack sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.utils'] = ( charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.utils) sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.templating'] = ( charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.templating) sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib.network'] = charmhelpers.contrib.network sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib.network.ip'] = ( charmhelpers.contrib.network.ip) sys.modules['charmhelpers.fetch'] = charmhelpers.fetch sys.modules['charmhelpers.cli'] = charmhelpers.cli sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib.hahelpers'] = charmhelpers.contrib.hahelpers sys.modules['charmhelpers.contrib.hahelpers.cluster'] = ( charmhelpers.contrib.hahelpers.cluster)

commit_message:
Use charms.openstack charmhelpers test_mocks

Every reactive charm that uses charms.openstack and implements unit
testing needs to mock charmhelpers, as otherwise the tests blow up.
This patch uses the mocking of charmhelpers in charms.openstack so that
a charm layer can just import test_mocks and charmhelpers will be mocked
out along with setting up a default
charmhelpers.c.o.u.OPENSTACK_RELEASES so that when an OpenStackCharm()
derived charm class won't fail on definition.

Change-Id: Id6537afcd24840a008a537543a15cfe5fd278886
Related-Bug: #1693017
Depends-On: I5ac40617ee30e5f421ec16fc7592177a5e6aa166

commit_message:
fix ec2-api after deprecation of nova-network functions in novaclient

removed NovaEngine in addresses, availability_zones, instances, security_groups
removed unit tests for NovaEngine
disabled some unit tests using NovaEngine for further reworking

Closes-bug: #1691484
Change-Id: I662d5b57b9e46be80c1d2093038ada83897565eb

commit_message:
Improve nested k8s devstack install mechanism

Current documentation suggest that to test nested use-case in devstack
one should comment out `configure_neutron_defaults` function for the
nested devstack. It also references an outdated line in the plugin.sh
file.
This commit introduces KURYR_CONFIGURE_NEUTRON_DEFAULTS setting (True by
default). If set to False `configure_neutron_defaults` would be skipped.
Also updates documentation and pod-in-vm.overcloud sample file.

Change-Id: I02dad9abe842b5c1c20bb7d3eaa0584320f9553a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-03 14:48:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/ea28309349fa29f8205b6bad21beccd6ce108dd2', 'message': "Introducing pydot3

The oslo.automaton library supports generating svg images of a state
machine using the pydot library[1] Ironic inspector would like to use this
to generate image of its state machine for the documentation[2] Currently
ironic inspector uses custom tox env with an additional dependency[3] but
we'd like to reuse global dependencies.  The pydot3 package was selected
because pydot2 has known issues in python3[4]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/automaton/api.html#module-automaton.converters.pydot
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/blob/master/tools/states_to_dot.py
[3] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/blob/master/tox.ini#L51
[4] https://github.com/erocarrera/pydot/issues/107

Change-Id: I82e3651eefd3186c9e131b0db29a328967fb3161
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-04 16:10:09.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/153d8d63744a9d91f75fab36e12813947eb9b34b', 'message': "Introducing pydot3

The oslo.automaton library supports generating svg images of a state
machine using the pydot library[1] Ironic inspector would like to use this
to generate image of its state machine for the documentation[2] Currently
ironic inspector uses custom tox env with an additional dependency[3] but
we'd like to reuse global dependencies.  The pydot3 package was selected
because pydot2 has known issues in python3[4]

Q: Is the library actively maintained?
A: Last commit from November 2016 [5]

Q: Is the library good code?
A: Single-file library, 500 sloc, no tests,
   fork of Pydot to fix python3-specific issues

Q: Is the library python 3 compatible?
A: The goal is to port pydot to python3;
   works with python3.6

Q: Is the library license compatible?
A: It is indeed; can be distributed under the MIT License conditions

Q: Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
   / Fedora latest)?
A: No

Q: Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
   global-requirements.txt?
A: No, although pydotplus seems similar but oslo.automaton svg exports
   didn't work for me

Q: Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
   infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
A: Yes, ironic-inspector would like to use it to be able to generate nice
   images of its state machine[2][3]

Q: Do I need to update anything else?
A: Having followed the proposing changes guidelines[6] a bump of
   click-repl===0.1.2 was observed in upper-constraints.txt

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/automaton/api.html#module-automaton.converters.pydot

Change-Id: I82e3651eefd3186c9e131b0db29a328967fb3161
"}]
commit_message:
Introducing pydot3

The oslo.automaton library supports generating svg images of a state
machine using the pydot library[1] Ironic inspector would like to use this
to generate image of its state machine for the documentation[2] Currently
ironic inspector uses custom tox env with an additional dependency[3] but
we'd like to reuse global dependencies.  The pydot3 package was selected
because pydot2 has known issues in python3[4]

Q: Is the library actively maintained?
A: Last commit from November 2016 [5]

Q: Is the library good code?
A: Single-file library, 500 sloc, no tests,
   fork of Pydot to fix python3-specific issues

Q: Is the library python 3 compatible?
A: The goal is to port pydot to python3;
   works with python3.6

Q: Is the library license compatible?
A: It is indeed; can be distributed under the MIT License conditions

Q: Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
   / Fedora latest)?
A: No

Q: Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
   global-requirements.txt?
A: No, although pydotplus seems similar but oslo.automaton svg exports
   didn't work for me

Q: Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
   infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
A: Yes, ironic-inspector would like to use it to be able to generate nice
   images of its state machine[2][3]

Q: Do I need to update anything else?
A: Having followed the proposing changes guidelines[6] a bump of
   click-repl===0.1.2 was observed in upper-constraints.txt

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/automaton/api.html#module-automaton.converters.pydot
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/blob/master/tools/states_to_dot.py
[3] https://github.com/openstack/ironic-inspector/blob/master/tox.ini#L51
[4] https://github.com/erocarrera/pydot/issues/107
[5] https://github.com/log0/pydot3
[6] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/requirements/#proposing-changes

Change-Id: I82e3651eefd3186c9e131b0db29a328967fb3161

commit_message:
Update Python code for Windows batch files

The osbash.sh code to produce the Windows batch files has seen several
improvements that have not been ported to Python. This changeset brings
all these changes to st.py.

To test the changes, it is sufficient to verify that the Windows batch
files generated by osbash.sh and st.py are now equivalent again.

Change-Id: I8514635e5b97f1b9388d532f32c7d2b2d35aecbf

subject: Set tmp directory for virt-sparsify
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-02 18:46:35.000000000', 'files': ['labs/stacktrain/kvm/vm_create.py', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/kvm-functions.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/676a4f13cb840facd48751911339d62784698ad0', 'message': 'Set tmp directory for virt-sparsify

virt-sparsify uses about 10 GB temporary work space. The default (/tmp)
is often too small (especially if it is a RAM disk) and filled up by
virt-sparsify which hangs when it runs out of space.

With this changeset, we use the pool_dir as a tmp directory. On typical
systems, this means that instead of /tmp, the root partition needs to
have an extra 10 GB of space left, which should be much more likely to
work.

Change-Id: I4bf66474d6338c0e2e8eb76126ee496b13bc3c46
'}]
commit_message:
Set tmp directory for virt-sparsify

virt-sparsify uses about 10 GB temporary work space. The default (/tmp)
is often too small (especially if it is a RAM disk) and filled up by
virt-sparsify which hangs when it runs out of space.

With this changeset, we use the pool_dir as a tmp directory. On typical
systems, this means that instead of /tmp, the root partition needs to
have an extra 10 GB of space left, which should be much more likely to
work.

Change-Id: I4bf66474d6338c0e2e8eb76126ee496b13bc3c46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/77/461877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # virt-sparsify uses about 10 GB additional, temporary work space. # The default (/tmp) is often too small (especially if it is a RAM # disk). We use the pool_dir instead. sudo "$spexe" --tmp "$pool_dir" --compress "$disk_path" \ "$pool_dir/.$disk_name"
deleted_lines: # Sparsify and compress basedisk image sudo "$spexe" --compress "$disk_path" "$pool_dir/.$disk_name"

commit_message:
Fix 'introspection bulk status' when some nodes were never introspected

Previously we did not handle exceptions from ironic_inspector_client, so nodes
that were never introspected (e.g. ones in maintenance mode) caused this
command to fail.

Change-Id: I58756256fe70992ff5618a3f307ce34f95e71efd
Closes-Bug: #1689540
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/49/463549/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The ``introspection bulk status`` command no longer aborts if some nodes in the Ironic registry were never introspected. See bug `1689540 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1689540>`_.

commit_message:
Use charms.openstack charmhelpers test_mocks

Every reactive charm that uses charms.openstack and implements unit
testing needs to mock charmhelpers, as otherwise the tests blow up.
This patch uses the mocking of charmhelpers in charms.openstack so that
a charm layer can just import test_mocks and charmhelpers will be mocked
out along with setting up a default
charmhelpers.c.o.u.OPENSTACK_RELEASES so that when an OpenStackCharm()
derived charm class won't fail on definition.

Change-Id: I3dd4954daa24ff16a9da8f2a64290e5013b55301
Related-Bug: #1693017
Depends-On: I5ac40617ee30e5f421ec16fc7592177a5e6aa166

commit_message:
use neutron-lib port security api-def

The port security API definition has been in neutron-lib for
awhile. This patch consumes the definition from neutron-lib. See
If43b65861efc536d01c43dc0d2bbcbcf062c1271 for additional
details.

Change-Id: Ia0be0363f1ee8a6c86b44673a8c2a4b7a02f0868
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/99/467899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api.definitions import port_security as psec
deleted_lines: from neutron.extensions import portsecurity as psec

subject: Enable per policy proxy config options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-21 19:11:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/a169940da9ee2e26a85ca140ff59603781ae1585', 'message': "WIP: Enable per policy proxy config options

This is an alternative approach to that proposed in [1]

Proof-of-concept: the per policy values are not yet plumbed
through so do not affect proxy behaviour. However, the unit
tests do assert that the config sections are correctly loaded.

Adds support for optional per-policy config sections
to be added in proxy-server.conf. This is highly desriable
to allow per-policy affinity options to be set for use with
duplicated EC policies [1]. e.g.:

  [proxy-server:policy:0]
  read_affinity = r1=100

Certain options found in per-policy conf sections will
override their equivalents that may be set in the
[app:proxy-server] section. Currently the only option
handled that way is 'read_affinity'.

[1] Related-Change: I9104fc789ba85ab3ab5ccd34096125b482821389

Change-Id: I3f718f425f525baa80045ba067950c752bcaaefc

commit_message:
Enable per policy proxy config options

This is an alternative approach to that proposed in [1]

Adds support for optional per-policy config sections
to be added in proxy-server.conf. This is highly desirable
to allow per-policy affinity options to be set for use with
duplicated EC policies [2] and composite rings [3].

Certain options found in per-policy conf sections will
override their equivalents that may be set in the
[app:proxy-server] section. Currently the options
handled that way are:

  sorting_method
  read_affinity
  write_affinity
  write_affinity_node_count

For example:

  [proxy-server:policy:0]
  sorting_method = affinity
  read_affinity = r1=100
  write_affinity = r1
  write_affinity_node_count = 1 * replicas

The corresponding attributes of the proxy-server Application
are now available from instances of an OverrideConf object
that is obtained from Application.get_policy_options(policy).

[1] Related-Change: I9104fc789ba85ab3ab5ccd34096125b482821389
[2] Related-Change: Idd155401982a2c48110c30b480966a863f6bd305
[3] Related-Change: I0d8928b55020592f8e75321d1f7678688301d797

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I3f718f425f525baa80045ba067950c752bcaaefc

commit_message:
Remove sleep() in _sync() to make it callable

Remove sleep in _sync() and do this delay when spawning greenthread,
then _sync() can be renamed to a callable method.
There are a few benefits, sync caller can simply call do_sync() instead of
sub-functions, and adding new sync sub-functions such as trunk, qos will
be simplified too,

Change-Id: I7b8acb9de0d2085443ac77c57fa4835f93241c55
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

subject: Stop cluster VMs when building basedisk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-02 18:48:11.000000000', 'files': ['labs/st.py', 'labs/stacktrain/virtualbox/vm_create.py', 'labs/stacktrain/core/functions_host.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-labs/commit/c8e44461b6fdd6d1f804bb23e154ddb6da846e16', 'message': 'Stop cluster VMs when building basedisk

A new basedisk can be built while a training-cluster is running (as long
as the new basedisk does not replace the basedisk used in the cluster).
However, on systems with 8 GB RAM there is not enough memory to keep
controller, compute and base VM running concurrently which can lead to
the host system becoming unresponsive.

With this patch, all running cluster VMs are shut down before a basedisk
is built.

Change-Id: Ic3cbd3ec1ab75e74ae67added4046f9d56c4b3b3
'}]
commit_message:
Stop cluster VMs when building basedisk

A new basedisk can be built while a training-cluster is running (as long
as the new basedisk does not replace the basedisk used in the cluster).
However, on systems with 8 GB RAM there is not enough memory to keep
controller, compute and base VM running concurrently which can lead to
the host system becoming unresponsive.

With this patch, all running cluster VMs are shut down before a basedisk
is built.

Change-Id: Ic3cbd3ec1ab75e74ae67added4046f9d56c4b3b3

commit_message:
Eliminate function redefined pylint error

Disable function redefined pylint error when redefining
is desired in v3/shell.py, also fix some typos.

Change-Id: Ic86b14ab7286a8a76f0db551ac6330211a509ff3

commit_message:
Coho: resize volume if cloned image is larger

Extend volume if during create_cloned_volume() the new volume
is larger than the image it was cloned from. Extended test case
to cover the change.

Closes-Bug: #1554753

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I1a602f18ad7ef78f23353f891571388eac742171
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

subject: API Evolution - ETAG identifiers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-04 17:07:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs/commit/820d13e32f8349062ea929dbf2447c4dbfbb46ff', 'message': "API Evolution - ETAG identifiers

This specification describes the implementation of ETAG identifiers.

This patch is part of a series of patches which propose several discrete units
of work, broken out into separate specifications for tracking. These have grown
out of the discussions around whether we should have a 'v2' API, and what
current pain-points we all experience with the current API. It is my belief,
after investigating all of the collected concerns, that we can implement many
of the desired changes incrementally and without a full 'v2' rewrite.

Change-Id: Id8dc039fbf56f7e74dd79256b7a223f6eb673ad2
Related-bug: #1605728

commit_message:
API Evolution - ETAG identifiers

This specification describes the implementation of ETAG identifiers.

This patch is part of a series of patches which propose several
discrete units of work, broken out into separate specifications for
tracking. These have grown out of the discussions around whether
we should have a 'v2' API, and what current pain-points we all
experience with the current API. It is my belief, after
investigating all of the collected concerns, that we can implement
many of the desired changes incrementally and without a
full 'v2' rewrite.

Change-Id: Id8dc039fbf56f7e74dd79256b7a223f6eb673ad2
Related-bug: #1605728
