subject: IP-Allocation override segment filtering for vnic_type 'baremetal'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-24 22:10:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_backend_mixin.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f27fb16faaaa86cb6f1b1f17095e87c9f000448d', 'message': "IP-Allocation override segment filtering for vnic_type 'baremetal'

WIP : Do not merge.

For Ironic baremetal nodes we do not have a host to bind to, thus
when using segments we need to do ip-allocation without knowing
the host the port will bind to when port create is called with
'fixed-ips' request.

This change adds a conditional to check the binding:vnic_type.
If binding:vnic_type = 'baremetal' the subnet filtering is ignored
in so that ip-allocation is not deferred.

Change-Id: I18b8a347dcfaad69570ff90c2a74bc95814d287d
Closes-Bug: #1693284
"}]
commit_message:
IP-Allocation override segment filtering for vnic_type 'baremetal'

WIP : Do not merge.

For Ironic baremetal nodes we do not have a host to bind to, thus
when using segments we need to do ip-allocation without knowing
the host the port will bind to when port create is called with
'fixed-ips' request.

This change adds a conditional to check the binding:vnic_type.
If binding:vnic_type = 'baremetal' the subnet filtering is ignored
in so that ip-allocation is not deferred.

Change-Id: I18b8a347dcfaad69570ff90c2a74bc95814d287d
Closes-Bug: #1693284
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/91/467791/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[TESTING] Fix the grenade gate

Currently, the rule of tempest is "Member" for a gate test
named gate-grenade-dsvm-barbican-ubuntu-xenial-nv. But it
must be "creator" rule.

I have a patch to setup in project-config [1] to do this but I
want to make sure that this is a right way to fix this problem
before convincing the core-reviewer in project-config.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/466174/

Change-Id: I305a20d0255a326c9c60155e995cf2c69be51b4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin refs/changes/02/467502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Use command instead of debug for handlers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-24 10:34:22.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cloudkitty/commit/32ec0260d2c11417c342ce47cfd2d735a19563c2', 'message': 'Use command instead of debug for handlers

Due to the debug message plugin the handler restart
messages show at the end of the playbook execution
which is a little confusing. Using debug also
requires setting changed_when to true which is a
little extra bit of code which we do not have to
carry.

Instead we use the command module which is simple,
works and less wordy.

Change-Id: I3562ef542ab4c87cd6bac82d916e5696149c8a6b
'}]
commit_message:
Use command instead of debug for handlers

Due to the debug message plugin the handler restart
messages show at the end of the playbook execution
which is a little confusing. Using debug also
requires setting changed_when to true which is a
little extra bit of code which we do not have to
carry.

Instead we use the command module which is simple,
works and less wordy.

Change-Id: I3562ef542ab4c87cd6bac82d916e5696149c8a6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cloudkitty refs/changes/79/467579/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use command instead of debug for handlers

Due to the debug message plugin the handler restart
messages show at the end of the playbook execution
which is a little confusing. Using debug also
requires setting changed_when to true which is a
little extra bit of code which we do not have to
carry.

Instead we use the command module which is simple,
works and less wordy.

Change-Id: Ic80a23df0d86258ae7931ebb0dea2bcea97187a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate refs/changes/80/467580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use command instead of debug for handlers

Due to the debug message plugin the handler restart
messages show at the end of the playbook execution
which is a little confusing. Using debug also
requires setting changed_when to true which is a
little extra bit of code which we do not have to
carry.

Instead we use the command module which is simple,
works and less wordy.

Change-Id: I3861447fe685b38ecb9dfad8f3dff666b160af36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/75/467575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

When the policy file is copied from the templated
file to the active file, it loses its group/mode
settings. This patch ensures that they are properly
replicated during the copy.

Else it overwrites the variable and python-heatclient is not
installed from repo.

subject: Use 'virt_type=kvm' in devstack vm if supported
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-24 08:58:44.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/5fbf9e6c3fca5158f59f2aa48bdd48a77c718923', 'message': "Use 'virt_type=kvm' in devstack vm if supported

If the devstack vm supports nested virtualization we should
use it.
This can done using by setting: DEVSTACK_GATE_LIBVIRT_TYPE=kvm.
This will increase the performance in gate jobs.

Change-Id: I2439de036dfec2ada3c92c2d4b71c73b5f41a518
(cherry picked from commit 34efcdfcafad3108e54fd4351a414f3a74e1ef6f)
(cherry picked from commit 907eeb28da0a03abb5b1c6702e53a32b576fec29)
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'virt_type=kvm' in devstack vm if supported

If the devstack vm supports nested virtualization we should
use it.
This can done using by setting: DEVSTACK_GATE_LIBVIRT_TYPE=kvm.
This will increase the performance in gate jobs.

Change-Id: I2439de036dfec2ada3c92c2d4b71c73b5f41a518
(cherry picked from commit 34efcdfcafad3108e54fd4351a414f3a74e1ef6f)
(cherry picked from commit 907eeb28da0a03abb5b1c6702e53a32b576fec29)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/34/467534/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if egrep --quiet '(vmx|svm)' /proc/cpuinfo; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_LIBVIRT_TYPE=kvm fi

subject: Clean up how PatchPolicies works
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-27 01:15:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/9d1711113468e70ef1141d086ba9e37e6f38c1a1', 'message': 'Clean up how PatchPolicies works

We've got these lovely __enter__ and __exit__ methods; let's use them!

Note that this also changes how we patch classes' setUp methods so we
don't set self._orig_POLICIES when the class is already patched.  I
*think* this should fix some sporadic failures that include tracebacks
that look like

  proxy ERROR: ERROR 500 Traceback (most recent call last):
    File ".../swift/obj/server.py", line 1105, in __call__
      res = getattr(self, req.method)(req)
    File ".../swift/common/utils.py", line 1626, in _timing_stats
      resp = func(ctrl, *args, **kwargs)
    File ".../swift/obj/server.py", line 880, in GET
      policy=policy, frag_prefs=frag_prefs)
    File ".../swift/obj/server.py", line 211, in get_diskfile
      return self._diskfile_router[policy].get_diskfile(
    File ".../swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 555, in __getitem__
      return self.policy_to_manager[policy]
  KeyError: ECStoragePolicy(...)

Change-Id: Iaa3d42ec21758b0707155878a645e665aa36696c

commit_message:
Clean up how PatchPolicies works

We've got these lovely __enter__ and __exit__ methods; let's use them!

Note that this also changes how we patch classes' setUp methods so we
don't set self._orig_POLICIES when the class is already patched.  I
hope this may fix some sporadic failures that include tracebacks
that look like

  proxy ERROR: ERROR 500 Traceback (most recent call last):
    File ".../swift/obj/server.py", line 1105, in __call__
      res = getattr(self, req.method)(req)
    File ".../swift/common/utils.py", line 1626, in _timing_stats
      resp = func(ctrl, *args, **kwargs)
    File ".../swift/obj/server.py", line 880, in GET
      policy=policy, frag_prefs=frag_prefs)
    File ".../swift/obj/server.py", line 211, in get_diskfile
      return self._diskfile_router[policy].get_diskfile(
    File ".../swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 555, in __getitem__
      return self.policy_to_manager[policy]
  KeyError: ECStoragePolicy(...)

... and try to unpatch more gracefully with TestCase.addCleanup

Change-Id: Iaa3d42ec21758b0707155878a645e665aa36696c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/62/460362/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self._orig_POLICIES = storage_policy._POLICIES if not getattr(cls_self, '_policies_patched', False): storage_policy._POLICIES = self.policies self._setup_rings() storage_policy._POLICIES = self._orig_POLICIES self._orig_POLICIES = storage_policy._POLICIES try: storage_policy._POLICIES = self.policies self._setup_rings() finally: storage_policy._POLICIES = self._orig_POLICIES

commit_message:
Replace the usage of 'admin_manager' with 'os_admin'

Alias 'admin_manager' has been moved to 'os_admin' in version Pike,
and it will be removed in version Queens. This patch is to replace
the usage of 'admin_manager' with 'os_admin' which mainly used in
Tempest scenario tests.

Change-Id: I2ee802a2dc20eb4f065ecccec127f817b1d6743c

commit_message:
Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

This replaces the deprecated (in python 3.2) unittest.TestCase
method assertRaisesRegexp() with assertRaisesRegex()

Change-Id: I219c09184bfe73c633ef0ba073270a5b5d227659

commit_message:
Handle uuid in HostAPI._find_service

This allows looking up a service in the HostAPI by its uuid
value to uniquely identify it in a list of cells. A later
REST API microversion change will rely on this to avoid the
ServiceNotUnique scenario.

Note that the existing service_get_by_id and service_delete
methods are used to minimize the impact to cells v1.

Since we don't have a service mapping table in the API DB we
still need to loop over cells.

A unit test is provided to show that the loop over the cells
is broken once we find the cell that the service lives in
and that the context is targeted to that cell.

Part of blueprint service-hyper-uuid-in-api

Change-Id: Ib82432f125649bc96b386c8f5895813cfbaa57dd

"""Deletes the specified service found via id or uuid."""
deleted_lines: :param service_id: The DB ID of the service to find cell_service = objects.Service.get_by_id(context, service_id) """Get service entry for the given service id.""" """Deletes the specified service."""

commit_message:
Fix 'QuotaIntegrationTestCase' testcase's random failure

Create volume type in testcase separately
to avoid internal interference.

commit_message:
Tests: Fix XIV unit hash randomization failure

This fails when using hash randomization because
fc_targets can be generated in a different order.

Change-Id: Ie548c90f5657e5270fd966207f453d5211e21867

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Schema-driven UI extension: conditional fields ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/schema-driven-ui-conditionals Describing all the new features of schema-driven UI in a single spec is impossible due to the sheer amount of changes, moreover we cannot prototype these new features in a waterfall approach (spec everything first, then implement everything). The reason is that some pitfalls may become evident only during the implementation phase. Thus the initial `Schema-driven UI spec`_ covers the basic features of new UI, while more sophisticated features are covered in their own documents. This document covers the conditional fields feature that the new UI should support. .. _Schema-driven UI spec: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/schema-driven-ui Problem description =================== TBD Conditional fields within a single wizard ========================================= TBD Conditional fields across wizards (passing the context) ======================================================= TBD

[WIP] Spec for multi-cloud support

APIImpact

Change-Id: I161cb760d119d0274c1c08ed003dddab2cafed2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-specs refs/changes/50/336350/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Multi Cloud Support in Murano ============================= Targets: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/murano-multi-cloud-support Add support for deploying multi-cloud applications using Murano. Problem description =================== Today Murano can deploy applications only on OpenStack using Heat This specification covers enhancements to Murano core library, API and UI to deploy applications across different clouds, based on the cloud configuration and the policies by cloud operator and/or by end user through user interface. Murano is shipped with number of classes that represent common infrastructure entities like Instance, Network etc. Those classes together are known as Murano Core Library and are used by most applications to interact with the underlying cloud. Currently those classes were written with only OpenStack in mind and their implementation mostly relies on OpenStack Heat API to create OpenStack resources. That makes it not sufficient for other clouds where there is no such API available and entities not always have the same properties as they have in OpenStack. Murano should additionally include support for the following clouds: * VMWare vSphere * Amazon Web Services Proposed change =============== Overall solution is comprised of number of improvements that need to be made in order to enable multi-cloud support: * Identity management. Credentials and principal cloud parameters should be stored in the database outside of environment scope so that they could be reused for different environments. Identity management, in turn, requires: #. Data model to store credentials in the database considering that different cloud platforms will require different parameters #. API to obtain/edit cloud credentials from both UI and MuranoPL code # UI forms to edit cloud credentials in dashboard. Again, each cloud platform requires its own UI forms. #. MuranoPL class hierarchy to represent and access credentials from MuranoPL code (by querying them from Murano API) * Bindings for cloud clients. In order for MuranoPL code to be able to access native cloud APIs of different cloud platforms explicit bindings for MuranoPL need to be written. Those bindings will wrap required subsets of API clients in a way that can be consumed from MuranoPL * Reworked resource class hierarchy. Classes that represent cloud resources need to be refactored so that base class will contain properties and methods common to most cloud platforms whereas cloud-specific class inheritors will extend it with features that are specific to given class and implement abstract methods from the base classes that cannot be implemented there. * Refactor Environment class not to contain any data and resources that are not shared across all clouds. Move them into classes that represent cloud instance and its credentials * Make each cloud resource aware of the cloud it belongs to. Applications may consume resources from different clouds. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- TBD (identity management) REST API impact --------------- TBD (identity management) Versioning impact ----------------- New version of the core library need to be release and versioned as 1.x.x Other end user impact --------------------- python-muranoclient need to be enhanced with support for introduced API calls regarding identity management. It will become a mandatory requirement for all applications targeting new core library. Deployer impact --------------- The need to store credentials for other cloud accounts might bring requirements for encryption or use of third party services for that matter which in turn might have deployer impact. Developer impact ---------------- New features should have minimum to none impact to the application code outside of core library. However it will become much more important to have correct contracts for resource classes in the applications. For example to use base class instead of OpenStack specific inheritor as it is commonly done now (without any good reason) Murano-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- Murano-dashboard will need to have support for management of cloud credentials. In order for dahboar to present user with cloud-dependent data (like list of existing images in target class) dashboard will be required to use json-schema form generation rather than UI definitions. Thus applications that target clouds other than OpenStack will not work with old dashboard versions. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- TBD Work Items ---------- TBD Dependencies ============ TBD Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== TBD References ========== TBD

commit_message:
Fixed MSSQL template to support 2008, 2014, 2016 versions

It has been tested with standard 2008/2012/2014 and enterprise 2016.
I've added the functions Get-MSSQLVersion that checks for the version,
and Get-MSSQLLogFile that finds the log folder for the MSSQL version used.
The function Get-MSSQLParameters has been updated to filter some install
arguments that are incompatible with versions of MSSQL diffrent from 2012.

Change-Id: I438a74b081fa6dd38d9e39c10b11497032e070cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/58/377658/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #ps1_sysnative # Copyright 2014 Cloudbase Solutions Srl # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop' $modulePath = "heat-powershell-utils.psm1" $currentLocation = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Path $fullPath = Join-Path $currentLocation $modulePath Import-Module -Name $fullPath -DisableNameChecking -Force $heatTemplateName = "MSSQL" function Log { param( $message ) LogTo-File -LogMessage $message -Topic $heatTemplateName Log-HeatMessage $message } function Install-RequiredFeatures { param() $windowsFeatures = @('NET-Framework-Core') $installStatus = Install-WindowsFeatures $windowsFeatures if ($installStatus.Reboot -eq $true) { Log "System will reboot to finish install updates." ExitFrom-Script $rebootAndReexecuteCode } } function Add-MSSQLUser { param( $mssqlServiceUsername, $mssqlServicePassword ) Log "Adding the MSSQL user." Add-WindowsUser $mssqlServiceUsername $mssqlServicePassword } function Copy-FilesLocal { param( $From ) $copyLocal = ${ENV:Temp} $fileName = Split-Path -Path $From -Leaf $localPath = Join-Path -Path $copyLocal $fileName Copy-Item -Force -Recurse -Path $From -Destination $localPath Log ("Local iso path:" + $localPath) return $localPath } function Get-MSSQLParameters { param( $MssqlServiceUsername, $MssqlServicePassword, $MssqlSaPassword, $MssqlFeatures, $MssqlInstanceName ) $parameters = "/ACTION=install " $parameters += "/Q " $parameters += "/IACCEPTSQLSERVERLICENSETERMS=1 " $parameters += "/INSTANCENAME=$MssqlInstanceName " $parameters += "/FEATURES=$MssqlFeatures " if (($MSSQLVersion -gt 12) -and($MssqlFeatures -split "," -contains "ADV_SSMS")) { Log "MSSQL 2016 is not compatible with this feature" } $parameters += "/SQLSYSADMINACCOUNTS=Admin " if ($MSSQLVersion -gt 10) {$parameters += "/UpdateEnabled=1 " } $parameters += "/AGTSVCSTARTUPTYPE=Automatic " $parameters += "/BROWSERSVCSTARTUPTYPE=Automatic " $parameters += "/SECURITYMODE=SQL " $parameters += "/SAPWD=$MssqlSaPassword " $parameters += "/SQLSVCACCOUNT=.\$MssqlServiceUsername " $parameters += "/SQLSVCPASSWORD=$MssqlServicePassword " $parameters += "/SQLSVCSTARTUPTYPE=Automatic " $parameters += "/NPENABLED=1 " $parameters += "/TCPENABLED=1 /ERRORREPORTING=1" return $parameters } function Get-MSSQLError { param() $sqlErrorString = "Failed: see details below" $errorsCount = (Select-String $sqlErrorString -Path $sqlLogFile).Length if ($errorsCount -ne 0) { Log "MSSQL log file has an error." return $true } return $false } function Add-NetRules { param() Open-Port 80 "TCP" "HTTP" Open-Port 443 "TCP" "HTTPS" Open-Port 1434 "UDP" "SQL Browser" Open-Port 135 "TCP" "SQL Debugger/RPC" Open-Port 5355 "UDP" "Link Local Multicast Name Resolution" netsh.exe firewall set multicastbroadcastresponse ENABLE $sqlServerBinaryPath = Join-Path ${ENV:ProgramFiles} -ChildPath ` "Microsoft SQL Server\MSSQL11.MSSQL\MSSQL\Binn\sqlservr.exe" New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "Allow TCP Sql Server Ports" ` -Direction Inbound -Action Allow -EdgeTraversalPolicy Allow ` -Protocol UDP -LocalPort 100-65000 -Program $sqlServerBinaryPath New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "Allow TCP Sql Server Ports" ` -Direction Inbound -Action Allow -EdgeTraversalPolicy Allow ` -Protocol TCP -LocalPort 100-65000 -Program $sqlServerBinaryPath } function Get-MSSQlVersion { Param([Parameter(Mandatory =$true)] [string]$MediaInfoXMLPath) if (!$MediaInfoXMLPath ){echo "MediaInfoXMLPath is not present!"} $xml = [xml](Get-Content -Path $MediaInfoXMLPath) try { return $xml.MediaInfo.Properties.Property[1].Value.ToString().SubString(0,2) } catch { # Note # for MSSQL Server 2008, the value does not exist return 10 } } function Get-MSSQLLogFile { param([Parameter(Mandatory = $true)] [string]$MSSQLVersion) $sqlLogFile = Join-Path ${ENV:ProgramFiles} -ChildPath ` ("\Microsoft SQL Server\{0}0\Setup Bootstrap\Log\Summary.txt" -f $MSSQLVersion) return $sqlLogFile } function Install-MSSQLInternal { param( $MssqlServiceUsername, $MssqlServicePassword, $MssqlSaPassword, $MssqlFeatures, $MssqlInstanceName, $MssqlIsoUNCPath, $MssqlWaitConditionEndpoint, $MssqlWaitConditionToken ) Log "Started MSSQL instalation." Install-RequiredFeatures Add-MSSQLUser $MssqlServiceUsername $MssqlServicePassword $localIsoPath = Copy-FilesLocal $MssqlIsoUNCPath Log "MSSQL ISO Mount." $iso = Mount-DiskImage -PassThru $localIsoPath Get-PSDrive | Out-Null $driveLetter = (Get-Volume -DiskImage $iso).DriveLetter $MediaInfoXMLPath = $driveLetter + ":\MediaInfo.xml" $MSSQLVersion = Get-MSSQLVersion $MediaInfoXMLPath $isoSetupPath = $driveLetter + ":\setup.exe" $sqlLogFile= Get-MSSQLLogFile $MSSQLVersion if (Test-Path $sqlLogFile) { Remove-Item $sqlLogFile -Force } $parameters = Get-MSSQLParameters ` -MssqlServiceUsername $mssqlServiceUsername ` -MssqlServicePassword $mssqlServicePassword ` -MssqlSaPassword $mssqlSaPassword ` -MssqlFeatures $mssqlFeatures ` -MssqlInstanceName $mssqlInstanceName ExecuteWith-Retry -Command { param($isoSetupPath, $parameters) Start-Process -Wait -FilePath $isoSetupPath ` -ArgumentList $parameters } -Arguments @($isoSetupPath, $parameters) Dismount-DiskImage -ImagePath $iso.ImagePath Remove-Item $localIsoPath if ((Get-MSSQLError) -eq $true) { throw "Failed to install MSSQL Server." } Add-NetRules $successMessage = "Finished MSSQL instalation." Log $successMessage Send-HeatWaitSignal -Endpoint $MssqlWaitConditionEndpoint ` -Message $successMessage -Success $true ` -Token $MssqlWaitConditionToken } function Install-MSSQL { param( $MssqlServiceUsername, $MssqlServicePassword, $MssqlSaPassword, $MssqlFeatures, $MssqlInstanceName, $MssqlIsoUNCPath, $MssqlWaitConditionEndpoint, $MssqlWaitConditionToken ) try { Install-MSSQLInternal -MssqlServiceUsername $mssqlServiceUsername ` -MssqlServicePassword $mssqlServicePassword ` -MssqlSaPassword $mssqlSaPassword ` -MssqlFeatures $mssqlFeatures ` -MssqlInstanceName $mssqlInstanceName ` -MssqlIsoUNCPath $mssqlIsoUNCPath ` -MssqlWaitConditionEndpoint $mssqlWaitConditionEndpoint ` -MssqlWaitConditionToken $MssqlWaitConditionToken } catch { Log "Failed to install template." Send-HeatWaitSignal -Endpoint $MssqlWaitConditionEndpoint ` -Message $_.Exception.Message -Success $false ` -Token $MssqlWaitConditionToken } } Export-ModuleMember -Function * -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

commit_message:
use worker from neutron-lib

neutron-lib 1.6 is out and among other things contains the rehomed
NeutronWorker class; now named BaseWorker in neutron-lib. This patch
updates references to use the lib version.

Since there's only 1 other consumer of these changes [1], this
patch depends on it so that it's free to merge after the single
consumer is updated.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron%20import%20worker

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Id6bd414ae90119bf527bcaca6b88cc33ff79f685
Depends-On: Ifc0ecf6d5d3d4f8c406caad233d3648646724b12

commit_message:
Fix etc/hosts format with baremetal role

While is not an issue, just an style format,
etc/hosts generated by baremetal role have
some tabs where it shouldn't.

Change-Id: I90d82ea78b3dac7e8ec3f8cc546b67cc61c41536
Closes-Bug: #1692913

commit_message:
De-complicate some of the instance delete path

Now that we are using separate targeted contexts in the delete path,
we can avoid some of the switch back and forth in that code.

Change-Id: I40ad635d8d361c6b1dccf7324d852f0c655a8c61

commit_message:
Use 'virt_type=kvm' in devstack vm if supported

If the devstack vm supports nested virtualization we should
use it.
This can done using by setting: DEVSTACK_GATE_LIBVIRT_TYPE=kvm.
This will increase the performance in gate jobs.

Change-Id: I2439de036dfec2ada3c92c2d4b71c73b5f41a518
(cherry picked from commit 34efcdfcafad3108e54fd4351a414f3a74e1ef6f)
(cherry picked from commit 907eeb28da0a03abb5b1c6702e53a32b576fec29)

added_lines: if egrep --quiet '(vmx|svm)' /proc/cpuinfo; then export DEVSTACK_GATE_LIBVIRT_TYPE=kvm fi

commit_message:
Fix handle_restore for server and volume resources

When resource references are used for properties restore
does not work for nova server and volume resources.

This patch fixes it and adds a functional test for it.

Change-Id: I34efb3f4e0d3578d95134793f5c5d413667790e0
Closes-Bug: #1687009

commit_message:
Fix check_snapshot_complete for nova server

Now that we're making glance client api calls to get the image
after the snapshot is created, the image status is returned
in lower case.

This also fixes handle_delete_snapshot to make the correct
client api call.

Change-Id: I60c84d4bc3ba75604b0c5bd6c4819cd0504f1cc8
Closes-Bug: #1691939

commit_message:
Add Tempest test plugin to Nova project

This adds the new nova-tempest-plugin repo to Nova governance,
as the beginning of the effort to provide a home for out of tree
tests which cannot be merged into Tempest currently.

Change-Id: I764ce06a6e2dc35f160afa0056d49324a58d80bf

commit_message:
Add new Tempest test plugin for the Nova project

As the discussion on [1] suggested some special purpose tests cannot be
merged in the main Tempest repository so this change proposes a Tempest
test plugin project in which this kind of tests can be developed and
maintained.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374887/

Change-Id: I9d6a07b81dabef6421a00f3572ed86acba62003b
Needed-By: I764ce06a6e2dc35f160afa0056d49324a58d80bf

subject: Avoid loading network and all rels for subnet query
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-28 16:29:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f0d46efed7b3c16fcc1dc3d2fb227b661cac14f0', 'message': 'Avoid loading network and all rels for subnet query

The Subnet model has a relationship to Network that is only
used for bumping the revision of the network. However, loading
the network loads all of its relationships as well so we end
up wasting a bunch of time loading segments, DHCP agents, etc all
for no reason. During a subnet update, we get the subnet from the
DB several times (policy engine, before update, after update,
and dhcp agent scheduler) so the slowness in get_subnet is amplified.

The recent switch to subqueries[1] has made loading all of this
unrelated data much more expensive since each relationship requires
a query, which was likely what brought this problem to the surface.

This adjusts the relationship to just load the standard attr object
of the network directly so we can still bump the revision of the network
without having to load the network itself.

This resulted in a ~20%-30% reduction of time spent in single update-subnet
operations on my dev environment (1sec to 650-850ms).

1. I6952c48236153a8e2f2f155375b70573ddc2cf0f

Closes-Bug: #1665967

commit_message:
Avoid loading network and all rels for subnet query

The Subnet model has a relationship to Network that is only
used for bumping the revision of the network. However, loading
the network loads all of its relationships as well so we end
up wasting a bunch of time loading segments, DHCP agents, etc all
for no reason. During a subnet update, we get the subnet from the
DB several times (policy engine, before update, after update,
and dhcp agent scheduler) so the slowness in get_subnet is amplified.

The recent switch to subqueries[1] has made loading all of this
unrelated data much more expensive since each relationship requires
a query, which was likely what brought this problem to the surface.

This adjusts the relationship to just load the standard attr object
of the network directly so we can still bump the revision of the network
without having to load the network itself.

This resulted in a ~20%-30% reduction of time spent in single update-subnet
operations on my dev environment (1sec to 650-850ms).

1. I6952c48236153a8e2f2f155375b70573ddc2cf0f

Closes-Bug: #1665967
Change-Id: Ie5f956ddf0704a5dde6e4f801a446f48fea5f697
(cherry picked from commit bc306a5512dc7d46737f1822cd2f827f87b95f9c)

commit_message:
Change cinder api_version to '3' in default

Block Storage API v2 is deprecated now. Instead of it, we should use v3
in default (api_version).

This patch replace cinder default api_version from '2' to '3' in
conf/cinder_client.py

Change-Id: I53ffa74cdac7ac31c74937bf18da8ed2fec92223
Closes-Bug: #1691104

commit_message:
Adds Networking-bgpvpn tests

Adds BGPVPN testcase. create_bgpvpn_assoc_disassoc_networks
and create_bgpvpn_assoc_disassoc_routers

Change-Id: I14afa0aec71ab8c6ce6759718d048adb4006687b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/88/464988/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__create_bgpvpn_network_assoc(self): network_id = "network_id" bgpvpn_id = "bgpvpn_id" value = {"network_association": { "network_id": network_id, "id": bgpvpn_id}} self.clients( "neutron").create_bgpvpn_network_assoc.return_value = value network = {"network": {"id": network_id}} bgpvpn = {"bgpvpn": {"id": bgpvpn_id}} return_value = self.scenario._create_bgpvpn_network_assoc(bgpvpn, network) netassoc = {"network_id": network["network"]["id"]} self.clients( "neutron").create_bgpvpn_network_assoc.assert_called_once_with( bgpvpn_id, {"network_association": netassoc}) self.assertEqual(return_value, value) self._test_atomic_action_timer(self.scenario.atomic_actions(), "neutron.create_bgpvpn_network_assoc") def test__create_router_network_assoc(self): router_id = "router_id" bgpvpn_id = "bgpvpn_id" value = {"router_association": { "router_id": router_id, "id": "asso_id"}} self.clients("neutron").create_bgpvpn_router_assoc.return_value = value router = {"router": {"id": router_id}} bgpvpn = {"bgpvpn": {"id": bgpvpn_id}} return_value = self.scenario._create_bgpvpn_router_assoc(bgpvpn, router) router_assoc = {"router_id": router["router"]["id"]} self.clients( "neutron").create_bgpvpn_router_assoc.assert_called_once_with( bgpvpn_id, {"router_association": router_assoc}) self.assertEqual(return_value, value) self._test_atomic_action_timer(self.scenario.atomic_actions(), "neutron.create_bgpvpn_router_assoc")

commit_message:
Fix rexray systemd unit

* remove existing rexray containers in ExecStartPre
* set volume tag to rshared
* fix indentation

Closes-Bug: #1686421
Change-Id: I71ffd708baac0403dae7d8f38a073240c44e0434

commit_message:
Return correct device path from Veritas connector

Libvirt volume driver for Veritas Hyperscale requires that
connect_volume return a different device_path.
Volume driver review link is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/
443951/16/nova/virt/libvirt/volume/vrtshyperscale.py@64

Change-Id: Id55dd78b65887336449145a684fe67c5bffb8dcf
Closes-Bug: 1691925

commit_message:
Make node-uuid param to port-create command positional

As the node-uuid is a mandatory argument to port-create command,
it is better to make it positional.

Change-Id: I6778b05a1811d453036717cdba4a884488ebc663

subject: placement: implement get_inventory() for libvirt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 19:36:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/838652bfa673b8eb76f77adbead86b154c296a53', 'message': "placement: implement get_inventory() for libvirt

Implements the get_inventory() method for the libvirt virt driver. In the
process, we add some code that merges information about allocation ratios and
reserved amounts from the compute node object into the inventory data returned
from the get_inventory() method. We're careful not to overwrite any inventory
information that was passed back from the get_inventory() call, such as is the
case with the Ironic virt driver's get_inventory() method that overrides the
allocation_ratio values to 1.0.

Change-Id: Ia74612dfb1a688a739f4537acf1eadfd29b9e8a2

commit_message:
placement: implement get_inventory() for libvirt

Implements the get_inventory() method for the libvirt virt driver. In the
process, we add some code that merges information about allocation ratios and
reserved amounts from the compute node object into the inventory data returned
from the get_inventory() method. We're careful not to overwrite any inventory
information that was passed back from the get_inventory() call, such as is the
case with the Ironic virt driver's get_inventory() method that overrides the
allocation_ratio values to 1.0.

Change-Id: Ia74612dfb1a688a739f4537acf1eadfd29b9e8a2

commit_message:
use is_port_trusted from neutron-lib

neutron-lib 1.6.0 is out and among other things contains the rehomed
is_port_trusted function. This patch switches usage of that function
from neutron to neutron-lib.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I1c8a32d4806092daae99cd4860523c7d6335fc75

commit_message:
Cannot use words: %, # in name

create a queue named "xx#yy", then the cli will return the
queue "xx#yy" is created. but actually the queue "xx" is
created by zaqar.

Change-Id: Ibbdc5d5abe312ad5cdde86b17b704a7bdd1aa824
Closes-Bug: #1584639

commit_message:
Fix neutron API tests

Previously test_is_extension_supported() in neutron API tests was
completely meaningless because it just checked the return value from
the mocked methods. This commit changes to mock the python neutronclient
method to test is_extension_supported correctly.

Change-Id: Id1da355fecd9c44db9b998521ba8b1f5aecf010a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/08/467808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-10 18:42:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-openstack-dashboard/commit/d964561c7624e3e341ff1ab6f86ff7bbf5a1a524', 'message': "Rework enforce_ssl to use host name, not address

This boils down to the template used to construct the site, which
is always fed an IP address by horizon_context.py.

Instead of using an IP address, use the public hostname.

commit_message:
Rework enforce_ssl to use host name, not address

If enforce_ssl is set to true in openstack-dashboard, a user is
redirected to the IP address of the server, not its hostname.

This boils down to the template used to construct the site, which
is always fed an IP address by horizon_context.py.

Instead of using an IP address, use the result of resolve_address.

(This is part of an odd quirk whereby the charm doesn't use the
standard https tooling but does its own. A conversion to standard
tooling would be required for a full fix to #1664954.)

Closes-Bug: #1689882
Related-Bug: #1664954
Change-Id: I93365b75211e3c48d64ba8510898750dbc7b73cd
Signed-off-by: Daniel Axtens <dja@axtens.net>

commit_message:
Replace the use of 'os_adm' with 'os_admin'

Property 'os_adm' has been moved to 'os_admin' in version Pike, and
it will be removed in version Queens. This patch is to replace the
usage of 'os_adm' with 'os_admin' in Tempest tests.

Change-Id: Ie4cf457d0a521910a82e41e7dad775df75d56587

Subsequent changes will be done to add VIF support, config drive and
console.

commit_message:
PowerVM Driver: spawn/destroy #4: full flavor

Building on Idfefc2db18d0f473a028b7bb8b593d39067e090d, this change set
completes the initial spawn/destroy sequence by bringing in full support
for flavor extra_specs.

Subsequent changes will be done to add disk support, VIFs, config drive
and console.

Change-Id: Icbf542c4bcc123cc003635387e40221fc8ac6466
Partially-Implements: blueprint powervm-nova-compute-driver

"""Connection to PowerVM hypervisor through NovaLink.""" from nova.virt import driver class PowerVMDriver(driver.ComputeDriver): pass

commit_message:
Stop warning on client_parameters

client_parameters is deprecated but we're still using it for
no good reason. All clients get their configuration from the
registry expect object-storage since it's not in lib yet.
However object storage clients can get their config from the
config module directly without going through client parameters.

Change-Id: I252a9ea9b7ed389c2708602c55a70b187721107a

""" # NOTE(andreaf) Once all service clients in Tempest are migrated # to tempest.lib, their configuration will be picked up from the # registry, and this method will become redundant. configuration = {} # Setup the parameters for all Tempest services which are not in lib. # NOTE(andreaf) Since client.py is an internal module of Tempest, # it doesn't have to consider plugin configuration. for service in clients._tempest_internal_modules(): try: # NOTE(andreaf) Use the unversioned service name to fetch # the configuration since configuration is not versioned. service_for_config = service.split('.')[0] if service_for_config not in configuration: configuration[service_for_config] = ( config.service_client_config(service_for_config)) except lib_exc.UnknownServiceClient: LOG.warning( 'Could not load configuration for service %s', service) return configuration # Mandatory parameters (always defined) params = self.parameters['object-storage']

commit_message:
Tests: remove .testrepository/times.dbm in tox.ini

Existance of this file causes py3* tests to fail if
run after py27. This patch adds cleaning up of this
file before running py3* tests.

Change-Id: Ib5f63fdff47bd13cd40554d021712bd8832e21a8
Closes-Bug: #1229445

commit_message:
Add syslog logging handler

Allow for logging to syslog, in case there's a need to aggregate logs.

Change-Id: I2d4f8cf991967b2f0058c46b7fa9ab988ae5f07d

commit_message:
Add Project tags

This spec aims to add a tags feature to projects in keystone
in order to allow projects to be tagged with simple strings
to aid in categorization and filtering.

Change-Id: I4a4db097ddf70c2a91b0119c0cf38526a45204a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/85/431785/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== Allow keystone resources to have tags ===================================== Blueprint `resource-tags <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/resource-tags>`_ Allow resources within keystone (Users, Projects) to be tagable to allow operators and administrators to be able to associate and map different Users and Projects within their groups. This specification follows closely with neutron's [#]_ resource tag implementation and would also follow the guidelines for using tags by the OpenStack API Working Group [#]_. Problem Description =================== Currently, in order to be able to mark or tag a User/Project in keystone, that operator/administrator must utilize the extras field to associate any specified markers for that User/Project. This extra field is not clearly defined and does not provide a API standard way to retrieve this data. Use Case 1: Project Organization via Tagging -------------------------------------------- In the case of a large private cloud containing many projects with lifespans that can range from days to a much longer time, there is a need to be able to tag and categorize projects based on how they are intended to be used, who is using them, and how long they will exist. The operator would be able to query all projects with a specific property without resorting to naming projects with particular conventions. Additionally, on project modification or deletion, proper cleanup of these tags could occur without the need of setting up an external tracking system. Currently, using an external system for keeping track of tags for projects is difficult for larger scale deployments, where projects change frequently and are often deleted within a few days. Use Case 2: User Organization via Tagging ----------------------------------------- In the case of a larger organization with many users, it would be useful to be able to label these users based on what location or organization they belong to. This is especially helpful with users who are from multiple locations and/or could belong to other organizations. It would be useful to be able to label these users based on what location or organization they belong to. Proposed Changes ================ Add a new column within the Project and User tables to store a list of values called "tags". On deletion of a user and project, any tags would also be deleted along with it. +---------------+--------------+-------+-----+---------+ | Field | Type | Null? | Key | Default | +===============+==============+=======+=====+=========+ | tags | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | +---------------+--------------+-------+-----+---------+ Add new API calls to interact with both Project and User tags for basic CRUD functionality. .. Note:: Tags will have the following restrictions: * Tags are case sensitive * / is not allowed to be in a tag name * Commas are not allowed to be in a tag name in order to simplify requests that specify lists of tags New API Calls ============= In the case of listing projects/users based on tags, the list of queries that can be performed are: * ``tags`` - Projects/Users that contain all of the specified tags * ``tags-any`` - Projects/Users that contain at least one of the specified tags * ``not-tags`` - Projects/Users that do not contain all of the specified tags * ``not-tags-any`` - Projects/Users that do not contain any of the specified tags Projects -------- List all tags of a project ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``GET /v3/projects/{project_id}/tags`` **Parameters** * ``project_id`` - The project ID. **Respone** .. code:: JSON { "tags": ["foo", "bar"] } List all projects that contain one or many tag(s) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``GET /v3/projects?tags={value1},{value2}`` **Parameters** * ``value1`` - The first tag value to search for * ``value2`` - The second tag value to search for **Response** List of projects that contain both tags List all projects that do not contain any of the specified tag(s) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``GET /v3/projects?not-tags={value1},{value2}`` **Parameters** * ``value1`` - The first tag value to search for * ``value2`` - The second tag value to search for **Response** List of all projects that do not contain both specified tags Check if a project contains a specified tag ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``HEAD /v3/projects/{project_id}/tags/{value}`` **Parameters** * ``project_id`` - The project ID. * ``value`` - The tag value. **Response** 200 - Exists 404 - Does not exist Add single tag to a project ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Creates the specified tag and adds it to the list in the project **Request:** ``PATCH /v3/projects/{project_id}/tags/{value}`` **Parameters** * ``project_id`` - The project ID. * ``value`` - The tag value. **Response** 201 - Created 404 - Project does not exist Modify all tags for a project ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Modifies the tags for a project. Any existing tags not specified will be deleted. **Request:** ``PUT /v3/projects/{project_id}/tags`` .. code:: JSON { "tags": ["foo", "bar"] } **Parameters** * ``project_id`` - The project ID. Add multiple tags to a project ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Modifies the tags for a project. Any existing tags not specified won't be affected. **Request:** ``PATCH /v3/projects/{project_id}/tags`` .. code:: JSON { "tags": ["one", "two"] } **Parameters** * ``project_id`` - The project ID. Remove tag from a project ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Remove the specified tag from the project with the given id. **Request:** ``DELETE /v3/projects/{project_id}/{tag}`` **Parameters** * ``project_id`` - The project ID. * ``tag`` - The tag to be deleted. **Response** 204 - Tag deleted 404 - Tag was not found Users ----- List all tags of a User ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``GET /v3/users/{user_id}/tags`` **Parameters** * ``user_id`` - The user ID. **Respone** .. code:: JSON { "tags": ["foo", "bar"] } List all users that contain one or many tag(s) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``GET /v3/users?tags={value1},{value2}`` **Parameters** * ``value1`` - The first tag value to search for * ``value2`` - The second tag value to search for **Response** List of users that contain both tags List all users that do not contain any of the specified tag(s) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``GET /v3/users?not-tags={value1},{value2}`` **Parameters** * ``value1`` - The first tag value to search for * ``value2`` - The second tag value to search for **Response** List of all users that do not contain both specified tags Check if a user contains a specified tag ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ **Request:** ``HEAD /v3/users/{user_id}/tags/{value}`` **Parameters** * ``user_id`` - The user ID. * ``value`` - The tag value. **Response** 200 - Exists 404 - Does not exist Add single tag to a user ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Creates the specified tag and adds it to the list in the user **Request:** ``PATCH /v3/users/{user_id}/tags/{value}`` **Parameters** * ``user_id`` - The user ID. * ``value`` - The tag value. **Response** 201 - Created 404 - Project does not exist Modify all tags for a user ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Modifies the tags for a user. Any existing tags not specified will be deleted. **Request:** ``PUT /v3/users/{user_id}/tags`` .. code:: JSON { "tags": ["foo", "bar"] } **Parameters** * ``user_id`` - The user ID. Add multiple tags to a user ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Modifies the tags for a user. Any existing tags not specified won't be affected. **Request:** ``PATCH /v3/users/{user_id}/tags`` .. code:: JSON { "tags": ["one", "two"] } **Parameters** * ``user_id`` - The user ID. Remove tag from a user ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Remove the specified tag from the user with the given id. **Request:** ``DELETE /v3/users/{user_id}/{tag}`` **Parameters** * ``user_id`` - The user ID. * ``tag`` - The tag to be deleted. **Response** 204 - Tag deleted 404 - Tag was not found Alternatives ------------ 1. Store the tags external to keystone. * Pro: No change to keystone required. * Con: Requires an external tool or work-around. If using some homebrew tool, this would need to be kept up-to-date with every release of keystone. If using an external system, this requires yet another tool to maintain and keep track of. Any updates for resources, such as deletion of a user or project, will require the corresponding tag data to be kept up-to-date in the external system. For larger scale deployments with many temporary projects that are regularly purged, this is both clumsy and difficult to maintain. 2. Store the tags in ``extra`` column. * Pro: No additional SQL table modification is needed. * Con: The ``extra`` column currently stores some ancillary data, e.g. user's email address. Allowing the API to modify this data may cause conflicts. There is not a standard API way to manipulate this data. Security issues are also a concern if there is a desire to limit who has access to this. Security Impact --------------- Typically, only the project admin should be able to create/edit the tags for a project. This is to avoid allowing unauthorized users to change any existing tags which could interfere with any administrative functions that these tags would be used for. Adding rules to ``policy.json`` to control role-based access to the API calls. .. code-block:: ini "identity:get_tags": : "rule:admin_or_owner", "identity:list_tags": "rule:admin_or_owner", "identity:create_tags": "rule:admin_required", "identity:update_tags": "rule:admin_required", "identity:delete_tags": "rule:admin_required" Notifications Impact -------------------- Any added API calls should emit the proper notifications. Other End User Impact --------------------- New API's will be available to operators with appropriate role(s) to manipulate keystone resource tags. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None. Developer Impact ---------------- None. subject: Notify L2pop driver from update_device_(up|down)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-16 02:12:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9f55d77016083ffb9c4d9cd3da5bb95de82186f7', 'message': 'Notify L2pop driver from update_device_(up|down)

This patch calls update_port_up and update_port_down inside
of the l2pop driver directly from update_device_up and
update_device_down in the ML2 RPC layer. This allows the L2pop
driver to setup forwarding entries completely independent of
the port status update events.

This will allow L2pop to function without requiring the ports to
transition from ACTIVE->BUILD->ACTIVE every time the agent requests
device details.

This will unblock the push notifications work and will additionally
enable us to remove the update to BUILD status as part of a performance
improvement backport for bug #1665215.

Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: Icd4cd4e3f735e88299e86468380c5f786e7628fe
'}]
commit_message:
Notify L2pop driver from update_device_(up|down)

This patch calls update_port_up and update_port_down inside
of the l2pop driver directly from update_device_up and
update_device_down in the ML2 RPC layer. This allows the L2pop
driver to setup forwarding entries completely independent of
the port status update events.

This will allow L2pop to function without requiring the ports to
transition from ACTIVE->BUILD->ACTIVE every time the agent requests
device details.

This will unblock the push notifications work and will additionally
enable us to remove the update to BUILD status as part of a performance
improvement backport for bug #1665215.

Partial-Bug: #1665215
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: Icd4cd4e3f735e88299e86468380c5f786e7628fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/04/464904/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixed python3 failure in functional tests using net_helpers

.write expects a byte string in python3, while we were passing a
str. It worked in py2 but failed in py3 with:

TypeError: memoryview: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'

Change-Id: I7f993a06bafa3cad4147f46d5d6dc10efeac3480

commit_message:
Init include_catalog for V3 client

The "include_catalog" can't be set and is always True.

This patch let V3 Client support init include_catalog.

Change-Id: I9d1ff5a6aaa2199e19c07920d2b6f6bdd6343daa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/37/448437/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param bool include_catalog: Include the service catalog in the returned token. (optional) default True. user_agent=USER_AGENT, connect_retries=None, include_catalog=True, **kwargs): self.include_catalog = include_catalog

commit_message:
Add strict option to discover_hosts

This adds a --strict option that can be passed in when calling the
nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts command. When this option is used,
the command will only return success if a new host has been found.
In any other case it is considered a failure.

Closes-Bug: #1692982

Change-Id: I942af11a3987e1edce67423c66931ad9ece65587
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/18/467218/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @args('--strict', action='store_true', help=_('Return success (0) only if a host is discovered. Any other ' 'result will return failure (1).')) def discover_hosts(self, cell_uuid=None, verbose=False, strict=False): hosts = host_mapping_obj.discover_hosts(ctxt, cell_uuid, status_fn) # discover_hosts will return an empty list if no hosts are discovered if strict: if not hosts: return 1 else: return 0
deleted_lines: def discover_hosts(self, cell_uuid=None, verbose=False): host_mapping_obj.discover_hosts(ctxt, cell_uuid, status_fn)

commit_message:
Force gpg to use port 80

Servers behind firewall might not be able to reach standard port
11371 on key server. We need to force gpg to use port 80.

Change-Id: Ic55073c666bbc61a309f7548b3e678fc86a0985d
Closes-Bug: #1693092
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/80/467480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gpg --keyserver hkp://hkps.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-key FC8A365E || \ gpg --keyserver hkp://pgpkeys.mit.edu:80 --recv-key FC8A365E
deleted_lines: gpg --keyserver hkps.pool.sks-keyservers.net --recv-key FC8A365E || gpg --keyserver pgpkeys.mit.edu --recv-key FC8A365E

commit_message:
policy library spec

Change-Id: If73f762463e8cae99f16d9e80baac330433c1b26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress-specs refs/changes/80/457880/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Example Spec - The title of your blueprint ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/congress/+spec/example Introduction paragraph -- why are we doing anything? A single paragraph of prose that operators can understand. Problem description =================== When Congress is first deployed, it does not perform any monitoring or enforcement because there are no policies specified. It takes significant investment in time and energy to learn the policy language and write the desired policies before Congress provides any value. To help deployers and administrators quickly get started and see value, we propose to include with Congress a library of useful policies that a deployer can easily enable, disable, and customize. Proposed change =============== Overview ------------ The proposed changes come in two main pieces, the new policy library and the changes to existing Congress server functionalities to support the use of policies from the policy library. The policy library ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Introduce a new concept of the policy library in Congress server, where policies are retained and manipulated but are not used by the policy engine (for monitoring or enforcement). Include with Congress server a collection of useful policies, each in a YAML file. These policies automatically populate the policies library. To make it easy for us to populate the library and for admins to modify/create their own library, the API (and GUI) should support full CRUD into the library. * Congress server can have new config option that points to a directory of policies to load into the library. * Reloads changed files automatically into library * Will not update policies imported from library into policy engine) * Care must be taken to consider concurrent changes from multiple congress server instances. * Installation * Standalone: installer scripts copy the default library directory from the Congress git repo into /etc/congress/. * Devstack: same as standalone Support for using policies from the library ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ We propose to add all the functionalities required to support the following workflows for activating a policy from the policy library (i.e., creating an (active) policy in the policy engine by importing a (inactive) policy from the policy library). * Activating a policy from library using CLI/API. #. Administrator inspects policies in library to find one they want to use. #. Administrator downloads the relevant policy, in YAML or JSON. #. Administrator modifies YAML/JSON encoding and uses it as the payload to create a new policy. * Activating a policy from library using GUI. #. Administrator peruses policies in library #. Administrator clicks on an interesting policy, which brings up a textbox (or more sophisticated policy editor) to customize. #. Administrator clicks on a Create button that creates that policy. Below are the specific functionalities needed to support these workflows. * A backward compatible change to the policies POST API to allow for a 'rules' key in the JSON/YAML payload. * A new optional parameter to the `policy create` CLI command that allows the administrator to import and activate a policy from a YAML file. * A new page in the Horizon GUI where an administrator can perform the following tasks. - inspect policies in the policy library - active (i.e., import to policy engine) a policy from the policy library - customize a policy in the policy library prior to import Alternatives ------------ TODO Policy ------ Not applicable. Policy actions -------------- Not applicable Data sources ------------ Not applicable. Data model impact ----------------- Two new database tables are needed: * A librarypolicies table to store the policies in the policies library. * A libraryrules table to store the rules in the policies in the policies library. Empty tables will be created using sqlalchemy migration scripts. Tables will be populated by Congress server from policy files in the policy libraries folder. REST API impact --------------- TODO Security impact --------------- In general, no major security impact is expected. However, below are some security considerations. * If policy library changes are sync'ed back to the policy library directory on the server, then an attacker who gains administrative privilege to Congress can also create and modify files in the policy library directory of the Congress servers. * The ability to submit multiple rules in a policy creation API can increase the potential for resource exhaustion attacks. Notifications impact -------------------- No impact Other end user impact --------------------- TODO (describe client changes) Performance impact ------------------ Minimal performance impact expected. Care must be taken to limit the performance impact of the feature to automatically detect changes in the policy library folder and update the policy library accordingly. Other deployer impact --------------------- TODO Discuss things that will affect how you deploy and configure OpenStack that have not already been mentioned, such as: * What config options are being added? Should they be more generic than proposed (for example a flag that other hypervisor drivers might want to implement as well)? Are the default values ones which will work well in real deployments? * Is this a change that takes immediate effect after its merged, or is it something that has to be explicitly enabled? * If this change is a new binary, how would it be deployed? * Please state anything that those doing continuous deployment, or those upgrading from the previous release, need to be aware of. Also describe any plans to deprecate configuration values or features. For example, if we change the directory name that instances are stored in, how do we handle instance directories created before the change landed? Do we move them? Do we have a special case in the code? Do we assume that the operator will recreate all the instances in their cloud? Developer impact ---------------- Minimal developer impact. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ No new dependencies. Testing ======= TODO Documentation impact ==================== TODO What is the impact on the docs team of this change? Some changes might require donating resources to the docs team to have the documentation updated. Don't repeat details discussed above, but please reference them here. References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. Examples of what you could include are: * Links to mailing list or IRC discussions * Links to notes from a summit session * Links to relevant research, if appropriate * Related specifications as appropriate (e.g. if it's an EC2 thing, link the EC2 docs) * Anything else you feel it is worthwhile to refer to

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Cyborg Generic Driver Proposal ============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/generic-driver-cyborg This spec proposes to provide the initial design for Cyborg's generic driver. Problem description =================== This blueprint proposes to add a generic driver for openstack-cyborg. The goal is to provide users & operators with a reliable generic implementation that is hardware agnostic and provides basic accelerator functionality. Use Cases --------- * As a user, I should be able to identify and discover attached accelerator backends. * As a user, I should be able to send API requests to discover services on each attached backend. * As a user, I should be able to attach/detach/list accelerators to a specific instance. * As a user, I shoud be able to manage connection of the instance to the accelerator. Proposed change =============== * Develop the generic driver implementation that supports CRUD operations for accelerators for openstack-cyborg. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- TBD REST API impact --------------- Documented in the Cyborg API spec. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- Developers will have access to a reference generic implementation which can be used to build vendor-specific drivers. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Rushil Chugh <rushil.chugh@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- This change would entail the following: * Add a feature to identify and discover attached accelerator backends. * Add a feature to list services running on the backend * Add a feature to attach accelerators to the generic backend. * Add a feature to detach accelerators from the generic backend. * Add a feature to list accelerators attached to the generic backend. * Add a feature to modify accelerators attached to the generic backend. Dependencies ============ Dependent on Cyborg API and Agent implementations. Testing ======= * Unit tests will be added test Cyborg generic driver. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
RBD:Move RBDVolume calls to a separate threads

RBD is a python binding for librados which isn't patched by eventlet.

Time-consuming operations like flattening and copying volumes
blocks eventlet loop and all cinder-volume service hangs
until it finished. It makes cinder-volume services unavailable for
a while.

This patch moves all RBDVolume calls to a separate python thread which
doesn't block eventlet loop.

Change-Id: Id3f2d48428d74011ba690141cee3afad8e48c52f
Closes-Bug: #1658037

commit_message:
bump neutron-lib to 1.7.0

The upper constraints for neutron-lib have already been bumped for 1.7.0
in I1671b056819960fd6409a4a2fcac7b6c620a6ca4, but we'd like to see the
requirement change propagated into all consumers so that we can begin
using the changes in neutron-lib between 1.6.0 and 1.7.0. This patch
bumps neutron-lib to 1.7.0 so consuming requirements.txt will be updated
allowing us to use the latest release in neutron and other networking
projects.

Change-Id: I455ded91d3102e310bdbc8e698b066f845613044

commit_message:
Add etcd3 to the list of base services

Ibbb430fb1dbf66942168e0cb52d990ab6a2eb8d7

commit_message:
Don't break root ssh with authorized_keys copy

For multinode testing we copy content into authorized_keys. Previously
we blew away any old content which meant that if you use eg root to ssh
to the host then you will no longer be able to do so. Address that by
appending to any existing content in authorized_keys files.

Change-Id: I163637d7cc7002b63d6d43eabfa573a56c916d36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/73/467773/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note that we append to the authorized keys file just in case something # is already authorized to ssh with content in that file. $ANSIBLE all --sudo -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m lineinfile \ -a "line={{ lookup('file', '/etc/nodepool/id_rsa.pub' }} dest='$path/authorized_keys' insertafter=EOF create=yes mode=0600"

commit_message:
Add method to ask mechanism drivers if dependent on DHCP

This adds a method to the mechanism driver API to ask the
drivers if they are expecting the in-tree DHCP service to
provide DHCP for them.

This defaults to False in the base API class and defaults
to True for the agent mechanism driver class.

This is used in to stop querying the DB for all DHCP
agents and parsing their configs on each port update/create.

Change-Id: Idd85f30113400e1a479e3e866fe4691d0b31463e
Related-Bug: #1453350

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from zun.common import context from zun import objects from zun.scheduler.filters import ram_filter from zun.tests import base class TestRamFilter(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestRamFilter, self).setUp() self.context = context.RequestContext('fake_user', 'fake_project') def test_ram_filter_pass(self): self.filt_cls = ram_filter.RamFilter() container = objects.Container(self.context) container.memory = '1024M' host = objects.ComputeNode(self.context) host.mem_total = 1024 * 128 host.mem_used = 1024 self.assertTrue(self.filt_cls.host_passes(host, container)) def test_ram_filter_fail(self): self.filt_cls = ram_filter.RamFilter() container = objects.Container(self.context) container.memory = '4096M' host = objects.ComputeNode(self.context) host.mem_total = 1024 * 128 host.mem_used = 1024 * 127 self.assertFalse(self.filt_cls.host_passes(host, container))

commit_message:
Machine-readable output for JSON/YAML format

Currently even if machine-readable format like JSON or YAML is specified,
formatted output is displayed. When machine-readable format is used,
they should not be converted by formatters.

Change-Id: I5f1e90ff60f30380106e1aa730f96a1f72c7a166
Closes-Bug: #1687955

commit_message:
Use charms.openstack charmhelpers test_mocks

Every reactive charm that uses charms.openstack and implements unit
testing needs to mock charmhelpers, as otherwise the tests blow up.
This patch uses the mocking of charmhelpers in charms.openstack so that
a charm layer can just import test_mocks and charmhelpers will be mocked
out along with setting up a default
charmhelpers.c.o.u.OPENSTACK_RELEASES so that when an OpenStackCharm()
derived charm class won't fail on definition.

Change-Id: I84eccd82f095c5c379c6d9850d266f38f589a4a4
Related-Bug: #1693017
Depends-On: I5ac40617ee30e5f421ec16fc7592177a5e6aa166

commit_message:
Use charms.openstack charmhelpers test_mocks

Every reactive charm that uses charms.openstack and implements unit
testing needs to mock charmhelpers, as otherwise the tests blow up.
This patch uses the mocking of charmhelpers in charms.openstack so that
a charm layer can just import test_mocks and charmhelpers will be mocked
out along with setting up a default
charmhelpers.c.o.u.OPENSTACK_RELEASES so that when an OpenStackCharm()
derived charm class won't fail on definition.

Change-Id: I703f7cc775a78cf3b56583316c3dcb8482751bfd
Related-Bug: #1693017
Depends-On: I5ac40617ee30e5f421ec16fc7592177a5e6aa166

commit_message:
Send both gratuitous ARP REQUESTs and REPLYs

Due to a linux kernel bug [1], network peers risk missing a gratuitous
arp update. This can be safely worked around by enabling arp_accept for
network interfaces that may receive those ARP packets [2]. Sadly, due to
another kernel bug [3], gratuitous ARP packets that we send are not
honoured by arp_accept. If we switch from REPLY to REQUEST packets, then
all recent kernels should enforce ARP table entry override on gARP
received.

REPLYs are left for backwards compatibility in case some network peers
honor REPLYs and not REQUESTs.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/760372/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1456272
[3] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/760373/

Related-Bug: #1690165
Change-Id: Iacd01875bf1299ff68fb5d1009d72088270320bb
(cherry picked from commit 82831b9d8d4bd61f90610df9eca8c7f6e447f8d8)

Replace test.attr with decorators.attr

Function 'tempest.test.attr()' has moved to 'tempest.lib.decorators

This patch replaces the 'tempest.test.attr()' with the 'tempest.lib
.decorators.attr().'

[1] Iaafbb112b6eee458089cc49918359a8a8d0485e2

commit_message:
Remove "list_volume" from filter

v3.25 introduced "list_volume" parameter for querying groups with
volumes. But it was used for filter and did not work as expected.

This patch pop it from the filter and let it work

Change-Id: If805a1975db2e7e63b63cb559a9c4dbe1d58b0a4
Closes-bug: #1664091
(cherry picked from commit 57930687b65aa11bbe1b724ec0397af5eb441337)

commit_message:
RBD:Move RBDVolume calls to a separate threads

RBD is a python binding for librados which isn't patched by eventlet.

Time-consuming operations like flattening and copying volumes
blocks eventlet loop and all cinder-volume service hangs
until it finished. It makes cinder-volume services unavailable for
a while.

This patch moves all RBDVolume calls to a separate python thread which
doesn't block eventlet loop.

Change-Id: Id3f2d48428d74011ba690141cee3afad8e48c52f
Closes-Bug: #1658037
(cherry picked from commit 8f2b7f4f20727d35d0dce25fddb5a879f26c9614)

commit_message:
Remove neutron library

As of Ansible 2.3, the os_network module now allows more additional
options for 'provider_network_type'[0]. Use of OSA's neutron plugin can
be removed.

[0] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5589

Implements: blueprint use-std-ansible-modules
Change-Id: If74185ecca1ea639c2e1526b5542e89dd533084b
Depends-On: I6713ad18fcf9e0675bb4af957aa59e5fa0e44a1c

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Pre-zoned port group fix

If there are more than one masking view on the same compute node
with different portgroups, then code did not always pick the
correct masking view to extract the port group from. This can
happen when a system is pre-zoned FC.

Change-Id: I6787f9415d97ce5988984f3aeac05c02c5217aac
Closes-Bug: #1682176
(cherry picked from commit 0a4acba0fcf651f3df5ea48c8054e067777d0528)

commit_message:
Added neutronclient dependency

Without that, we hit ImportError when calling to build-nodes-json,
apparently because openstack-virtual-baremetal is not installed with
pip.

Change-Id: If34ca27f64e56fe82bea4f972305d541e8f65972

commit_message:
Add support of refereshing the resource info in local cache

The local resource caching mechanism may cause legacy resource info
resided in the local cache and never be cleaned, uless the service
being restarted. e.g. an instance has been migrated to another host, the
instance info will reside in the cache on the ceilometer-polling
service running on the old compute host.

Change-Id: I55f12ea9f6f6104de6a38b98ad935d458a7b0cc8
Closes-Bug: #1594285
Closes-Bug: #1656166
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/12/467012/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | A local cache is used when polling instance metrics to minimise calls Nova API. A new option is added `resource_cache_expiry` to configure a time to live for cache before it expires. This resolves issue where migrated instances are not removed from cache. This is only relevant when `instance_discovery_method` is set to `naive`. It is recommended to use `libvirt_metadata` if possible.

subject: Fix compute create volume test race condition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-24 16:24:26.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/compute/test_volume_rbac.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/944e8bc267c5c324f2056cae1d96e1563d02cf2a', 'message': 'Fix compute create volume test race condition

Currently, create_volume test in test_volume_rbac in compute
module can fail [0] because of a race condition associated
with not waiting for the volume to reach 'active' status
following creation. Normally this is not an issue because
the class helper method "create_volume" is used which
does this in the background, but in this particular test,
create_volume is called via the volumes_extensions_client,
so no wait is currently being done.

This patch adds a wait for the volume to reach 'active'
status.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/71/466871/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial/fbb5290/console.html

Change-Id: I8c16fab69502fe94e39a63afbb94eee72cc4cac1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix compute create volume test race condition

Currently, create_volume test in test_volume_rbac in compute
module can fail [0] because of a race condition associated
with not waiting for the volume to reach 'active' status
following creation. Normally this is not an issue because
the class helper method "create_volume" is used which
does this in the background, but in this particular test,
create_volume is called via the volumes_extensions_client,
so no wait is currently being done.

This patch adds a wait for the volume to reach 'active'
status.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/71/466871/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-admin-ubuntu-xenial/fbb5290/console.html

Change-Id: I8c16fab69502fe94e39a63afbb94eee72cc4cac1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/72/467672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common import waiters # Use the admin volumes client to wait, because waiting involves # calling show API action which enforces a different policy. waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status(self.os_admin.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'available') # Use non-deprecated volumes_client for deletion. self.addCleanup(self.volumes_client.delete_volume, volume['id'])

Change-Id: I9c1e2f50c81d33c434efb1a5b6fb2cd46b214af7

commit_message:
Add instruction on shutting down and restarting complete kolla-ansible environment.

Change-Id: I9c1e2f50c81d33c434efb1a5b6fb2cd46b214af7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/76/466876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _security: ============== Kolla Ansible Operations Best Practices ============== kolla-ansible environment shutdown and restart =================== Shutting down the kolla-ansible environment is not as easy as shutting down all nodes blindly. mariadb use Galera to ensure synchronisation and it will not tolarate going down abruptly. This section will provide a method that will allow you to restart your environment after a complete shutdown. Steps ===== Find your mariadb password in your /etc/kolla/passwords.yml file: :: grep ^database_password /etc/kolla/passwords.yml | cut -d' ' -f 2 ckZoS17Pkg4LfMZJQIhKoJvML4P6KnOhm4lk3znW Take note of the password. It will be required later. Get a list of all the controller nodes by looking in your multinode deployment file. For example: :: [control] # These hostname must be resolvable from your deployment host kolla1.ducourrier.com kolla2.ducourrier.com SSH into each node one by one and run the following commands. Use the password you got earlier after the "-p": :: ssh root@kolla1.ducourrier.com docker exec -it mariadb mysqladmin -u root -pckZoS17Pkg4LfMZJQIhKoJvML4P6KnOhm4lk3znW shutdown ; docker stop mariadb exit ssh root@kolla2.ducourrier.com docker exec -it mariadb mysqladmin -u root -pckZoS17Pkg4LfMZJQIhKoJvML4P6KnOhm4lk3znW shutdown ; docker stop mariadb exit Shutdown all your kolla-ansible nodes and perform any maintenance needed. After rebooting all your kolla-ansible nodes login to the deployment node and run: :: kolla-ansible mariadb_recovery -i multinode Everything should now be back to normal.
